Q/A.answer: Compile the file into a DVI file by using the latex command: $ latex example.tex.

Q/A.question: What command do you use to convert a DVI file to a PDF?
Q/A.answer: $ dvipdfmx example.dvi

Q/A.question: What might cause the output PDF to not look correct?
Q/A.answer: If the output PDF does not look quite right, you may need to use different conversion tools.

Q/A.question: What is available for further reading on LaTeX?
Q/A.answer: LaTeX project documentation and more LaTeX to PDF options can be found on dedicated pages.

Q/A.question: What are the Portland Group C and Fortran compilers used for?
Q/A.answer: They are available for use under /opt/common/pgi* on supported RHEL/Ubuntu hosts.

Q/A.question: Where can the Portland Group C and Fortran compilers be found on supported systems?
Q/A.answer: /opt/common/pgi*

Q/A.question: What environment variable must be set to use the PGI compilers?
Q/A.answer: The LM_LICENSE_FILE environment variable.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the LM_LICENSE_FILE variable?
Q/A.answer: It specifies the location of the license files for the PGI compilers.

Q/A.question: How can you set the LM_LICENSE_FILE variable in tcsh?
Q/A.answer: By using the command: setenv LM_LICENSE_FILE $LM_LICENSE_FILE:/etc/license.dat:/etc/license.pgi

Q/A.question: What is the bash command to export the LM_LICENSE_FILE variable?
Q/A.answer: export LM_LICENSE_FILE="$LM_LICENSE_FILE:/etc/license.dat:/etc/license.pgi"

Q/A.question: What files are listed in the LM_LICENSE_FILE environment variable configuration?
Q/A.answer: /etc/license.dat and /etc/license.pgi

Q/A.question: In which operating systems can you use the Portland Group C and Fortran compilers according to the text?
Q/A.answer: RHEL (Red Hat Enterprise Linux) and Ubuntu.

Q/A.question: What does RHEL stand for?
Q/A.answer: Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

Q/A.question: What client is used to access the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: The Ivanti Connect Secure Client.

Q/A.question: Can you establish a VPN connection through a web browser?
Q/A.answer: Yes, by going to https://vpn.umiacs.umd.edu/, but it may fail if an outdated version of Ivanti Secure is installed.

Q/A.question: What requirement is necessary for computers with ARM-based processors when using the VPN?
Q/A.answer: They require a different installer than the standard Windows one.

Q/A.question: What are the prerequisites needed to connect to the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: A full UMIACS account, device enrolled with UMIACS Duo for multi-factor authentication, and an established network connection (wired or wireless).

Q/A.question: How do you start the Ivanti Secure client on Windows?
Q/A.answer: Start the client from the Start Menu or double-click its icon from the status bar if it is already running.

Q/A.question: What URL should be entered for the VPN server when setting up a connection?
Q/A.answer: 'vpn.umiacs.umd.edu'.

Q/A.question: What do you enter in the Secondary Password field for multi-factor authentication if you want a push notification?
Q/A.answer: Type the word 'push' into the secondary password box.

Q/A.question: What happens when attempting to connect without proper credentials?
Q/A.answer: You will be prompted for credentials twice due to the multi-factor authentication requirement.

Q/A.question: What does a green arrow icon in the status bar signify?
Q/A.answer: It indicates that you are connected to the VPN.

Q/A.question: What should users of ARM processors do regarding x64 or x86 programs?
Q/A.answer: They cannot natively run these programs without special emulation.

Q/A.question: What is recommended for machines with ARM processors to run Pulse Secure?
Q/A.answer: Use the version of Pulse Secure that is specifically made for ARM processors.

Q/A.question: What service is mentioned that requires interaction with UMIACS Tech Staff to register?
Q/A.answer: The YubiKey for use with the VPN.

Q/A.question: What should you click to ensure that Duo automatically uses your preferred authentication method?
Q/A.answer: Select ‘Save Settings’ on the secondary authentication prompt.

Q/A.question: What is no longer supported by Ivanti?
Q/A.answer: 32-bit clients.

Q/A.question: What compilers are supported on RedHat hosts according to the page?
Q/A.answer: The page mentions support for Intel C/C++ Composer XE for Linux and Intel Fortran Composer XE for Linux, as well as some older versions of the C/C++ and Fortran compilers that were shipped by Intel.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to load a pre-configured GNU Module file on RHEL7+/Ubuntu hosts?
Q/A.answer: You can run 'module load intel/2020.1' to load a pre-configured GNU Module file.

Q/A.question: Which file needs to be sourced for tcsh/csh users to set up the Intel C/C++ compiler version 13.1.1?
Q/A.answer: For tcsh/csh users, you need to source 'bin/iccvars.csh' for the 64bit 13.1.1 version of the compiler.

Q/A.question: What architecture specification is required when sourcing the Intel compiler scripts?
Q/A.answer: You need to specify 'ia32' for 32bit users and 'intel64' for 64bit users.

Q/A.question: Provide an example command for setting up the Intel C/C++ compiler version 13.1.1 for 64bit on a RHEL7+ host.
Q/A.answer: The example command is: 'source /opt/common/intel/composer_xe_2013_sp1.1.106/bin/iccvars.csh intel64'.

Q/A.question: What command is used to compile with the Intel C Compiler?
Q/A.answer: You use the 'icc' command to compile with the Intel C Compiler.

Q/A.question: What files need to be sourced for bash users when using the Intel Fortran compiler?
Q/A.answer: Bash users need to source 'bin/ifortvars.sh'.

Q/A.question: What is the path for the Intel Fortran compiler version 11.1 on RHEL7+/Ubuntu?
Q/A.answer: The path for Intel Fortran compiler version 11.1 is '/opt/common/intel/Compiler/11.1/current'.

Q/A.question: In the text provided, how many versions of the Intel C/C++ compilers are listed?
Q/A.answer: Four versions of the Intel C/C++ compilers are listed: 10.0.026, 11.1, 2011.1, and 13.1.1.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of sourcing the compiler configuration scripts?
Q/A.answer: The purpose of sourcing the compiler configuration scripts is to set up the environment for using the Intel compilers correctly based on the user's shell and architecture.

Q/A.question: What is the primary backup tool discussed in the article for creating personal backups on Windows devices?
Q/A.answer: The primary backup tool discussed is Windows' built-in backup tool, File History.

Q/A.question: What types of drives are recommended for use as backup drives in the article?
Q/A.answer: A portable hard drive formatted with the NTFS file system is recommended.

Q/A.question: What operating systems are supported for personal backups as mentioned in the prerequisites?
Q/A.answer: Any desktop edition of Windows 10/11 is supported.

Q/A.question: What steps must be taken to enable File History for backups?
Q/A.answer: Insert your portable hard drive, search File History in the start menu, click Add a drive, and select your portable drive.

Q/A.question: How often does File History back up the default folders?
Q/A.answer: File History backs up the default folders at the default interval of one hour.

Q/A.question: What happens to backups if the drive is disconnected for 5 days or more?
Q/A.answer: If the drive is disconnected for 5 days or more, you will receive a Windows notification and backups will automatically resume once you reconnect the drive.

Q/A.question: How can users manage the folders included or excluded from the backup?
Q/A.answer: Users can manage included/excluded folders or configure backup schedules by clicking on More options.

Q/A.question: What additional security measure does the article encourage for personal backups?
Q/A.answer: The article strongly encourages encrypting backups.

Q/A.question: In which directory does File History back up user files by default?
Q/A.answer: File History backs up all folders in C:\Users\<yourusername> by default.

Q/A.question: What can users do if they want to initiate a backup manually?
Q/A.answer: Users can manually start a backup by clicking 'Back up now' from the More options menu.

Q/A.question: What types of hard drives can BitLocker be used on?
Q/A.answer: BitLocker can be used on fixed hard drives as well as on portable hard drives.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended file system format for a portable hard drive to use with BitLocker?
Q/A.answer: The preferred file system format for a portable hard drive is NTFS.

Q/A.question: What minimum edition of Windows is required to use BitLocker?
Q/A.answer: Any desktop edition of Windows 10/11 except Home is required to use BitLocker.

Q/A.question: What tool is needed to initialize the YubiKey for BitLocker?
Q/A.answer: The YubiKey personalization tool is needed to initialize the YubiKey.

Q/A.question: What key length should be set for the password configured in Slot 2 of the YubiKey?
Q/A.answer: The password length should be changed to 48 characters.

Q/A.question: What happens if you lose the YubiKey used for encrypting the drive?
Q/A.answer: You will need to buy a new YubiKey, decrypt BitLocker on the drive, and then repeat the initial procedure to re-encrypt it with the new YubiKey.

Q/A.question: How can you unlock the drive using a YubiKey?
Q/A.answer: To unlock the drive, physically plug the drive and YubiKey in, click the notification, and touch the YubiKey's sensor for 3 seconds.

Q/A.question: What should you do with the recovery key text file after saving it?
Q/A.answer: You should delete the recovery key text file permanently to maintain security.

Q/A.question: Explain the purpose of setting up auto-unlock for BitLocker-encrypted drives.
Q/A.answer: Auto-unlock allows an encrypted drive to automatically unlock for specific users when plugged into specific computers without requiring the YubiKey or recovery key.

Q/A.question: Why is it not recommended to enable auto-unlock?
Q/A.answer: It is not recommended because it undermines the separation of unlock methods for the drive from any specific computer.

Q/A.question: What must you do before accessing an encrypted drive for backup purposes?
Q/A.answer: You must unlock the drive each time when plugging it into a computer or have configured auto-unlock for that computer.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you want to set up the BitLocker-encrypted drive as a backup drive?
Q/A.answer: Follow the procedure on the provided page to set up automatic backup to the encrypted drive.

Q/A.question: What does the menu prompt after choosing to turn on BitLocker ask you?
Q/A.answer: The menu will ask how you want to unlock the drive and how to back up the recovery key.

Q/A.question: What is BitLocker To Go?
Q/A.answer: BitLocker To Go allows users to use BitLocker on portable drives to secure sensitive data with a hardware token as the key.

Q/A.question: What should you back up as a recovery option when using BitLocker?
Q/A.answer: You should back up the recovery key, as it is the only way to access the encrypted drive if you lose the YubiKey.

Q/A.question: What is required to access the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: A full UMIACS account, a device enrolled with UMIACS Duo for multi-factor authentication, and an established network connection (wired or wireless).

Q/A.question: List the steps to download and install the Pulse Secure Client on a Debian-based Linux system.
Q/A.answer: Download the 64 bit Pulse Secure Client .deb file, navigate to the download location in terminal, and run 'sudo dpkg -i <insert_filename_here>.deb'. You also need to install dependencies with 'sudo apt-get install libnss3-tools net-tools' beforehand.

Q/A.question: What command is used to install the Pulse Secure Client on a Fedora-based Linux system?
Q/A.answer: You would run 'sudo rpm -i <insert_filename_here>.rpm'.

Q/A.question: What should you enter as the server URL when creating a new VPN connection?
Q/A.answer: The server URL is 'vpn.umiacs.umd.edu'.

Q/A.question: What are the three options for the secondary password when connecting to the VPN?
Q/A.answer: 'push', 'phone', or '<press YubiKey>'.

Q/A.question: How can a user save their preferred secondary authentication method?
Q/A.answer: By selecting 'Save Settings' on the secondary authentication prompt.

Q/A.question: What action should you take to check the connection status of the VPN?
Q/A.answer: Launch the Pulse Client GUI and select the down arrow to show the connection status.

Q/A.question: What additional requirement is mentioned for using a YubiKey with the VPN?
Q/A.answer: You need to register the YubiKey with UMIACS Tech Staff.

Q/A.question: What are the two main flavors of Java mentioned in the document?
Q/A.answer: The two main flavors of Java mentioned are Oracle Java and OpenJDK.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Java Runtime Environment (JRE)?
Q/A.answer: The JRE is usually sufficient for running programs and applets written in Java.

Q/A.question: Is it necessary to install both JRE and JDK?
Q/A.answer: No, it is not necessary to install both because JRE is included in JDK.

Q/A.question: How can you check the version of Java running on a machine?
Q/A.answer: The version of Java can be checked by running the command 'java -version' on any RHEL/Ubuntu machine.

Q/A.question: What command is used to check the Java version?
Q/A.answer: 'bash-4.2$ java -version' is the command used to check the Java version.

Q/A.question: Where can alternative JDK and JRE options be found?
Q/A.answer: Alternative JDK and JRE options can be found in /usr/lib/jvm.

Q/A.question: What happens to JRE installations on supported workstations?
Q/A.answer: JRE is installed by default on all supported workstations and is auto-updated to the latest version periodically.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if their machine does not have Java installed?
Q/A.answer: If a machine does not have Java, the user may send a request to staff to have JRE or JDK installed.

Q/A.question: What is the contact method for requesting Java installation?
Q/A.answer: The contact method is via email to staff at 'staff@umiacs.umd.edu'.

Q/A.question: Is JRE sufficient for programming in Java?
Q/A.answer: No, JRE is usually sufficient for running Java programs, but for programming, JDK is required.

Q/A.question: Who handles malware removal for UMIACS-supported systems?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS staff fully handles malware removal for any UMIACS-supported system.

Q/A.question: What is the risk associated with malware infections, especially over time?
Q/A.answer: The longer the malware had time to propagate, the greater the risk that private information may have been collected by a third party and could cause further harm.

Q/A.question: What action should you take if you are directed to the Malware Recovery page?
Q/A.answer: You are highly recommended to change all passwords for applications and websites you have visited while the machine was infected.

Q/A.question: What should you monitor regarding credit card transactions after a malware infection?
Q/A.answer: You should keep a close eye on your credit card transactions for the next several weeks after the machine has been cleansed, especially if online purchases were made using the infected machine.

Q/A.question: List three websites where users can change their passwords after a malware infection.
Q/A.answer: 1. UMIACS - https://intranet.umiacs.umd.edu/password 2. UMD - https://directory.umd.edu/password 3. Google/Gmail - https://www.google.com/settings/security?service=ha_reset_pw

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they notice odd behavior from their previously infected machine?
Q/A.answer: They should email staff at staff@umiacs.umd.edu or contact the HelpDesk ASAP so that further investigation can occur.

Q/A.question: What could indicate that a system was not fully cleansed from malware?
Q/A.answer: If the odd behavior that originally indicated the infection reoccurs, it may be the case that the system was not fully cleansed.

Q/A.question: Why is it important to change passwords after a suspected malware infection?
Q/A.answer: It is important because the malware may have collected private information that could be used maliciously.

Q/A.question: What are the potential consequences of not monitoring your credit card transactions post-infection?
Q/A.answer: Not monitoring your credit card transactions could result in financial loss or unauthorized charges if your information was compromised.

Q/A.question: If a user made online purchases on an infected machine, how long should they monitor their transactions?
Q/A.answer: They should monitor their credit card transactions for the next several weeks after the machine has been cleansed.

Q/A.question: What is the first step recommended for users who are identified as at risk for malware infection?
Q/A.answer: The first step recommended is to change all passwords for applications and websites they visited while the machine was infected.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to show the status of partitions in the SLURM cluster?
Q/A.answer: The command 'sinfo' can be used to show the status of partitions in the SLURM cluster.

Q/A.question: What flag should be passed to the sinfo command to see each node individually?
Q/A.answer: The '-N' flag should be passed to the sinfo command to see each node individually.

Q/A.question: Based on the sinfo command output, how many nodes are in the 'gamma' partition?
Q/A.answer: There are 3 nodes in the 'gamma' partition, and they are all in 'idle' state.

Q/A.question: What command is used to view the status and configuration of the nodes in the SLURM cluster?
Q/A.answer: The command 'scontrol' is used to view the status and configuration of the nodes in the cluster.

Q/A.question: What is displayed when specific node names are passed to the scontrol command?
Q/A.answer: When specific node names are passed to the scontrol command, only information about those node(s) will be displayed, otherwise all nodes will be listed.

Q/A.question: How many CPU cores does the node 'tron05' have according to the scontrol command output?
Q/A.answer: The node 'tron05' has 32 CPU cores.

Q/A.question: What is the state of the node 'tron13', and how many GPUs does it have?
Q/A.answer: The node 'tron13' is in 'MIXED' state and has 4 GPUs.

Q/A.question: What command will list the available QoSes in the cluster according to the sacctmgr section?
Q/A.answer: The command 'sacctmgr list qos' will list the available QoSes in the cluster.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum wall time for the 'normal' QoS based on the sacctmgr output?
Q/A.answer: The maximum wall time for the 'normal' QoS is 2 days.

Q/A.question: What does the 'MaxJobsPU' represent in the sacctmgr command output?
Q/A.answer: 'MaxJobsPU' represents the maximum number of jobs per user for that QoS.

Q/A.question: Explain the significance of the 'State' column in the sinfo output.
Q/A.answer: The 'State' column indicates the current status of the nodes, such as 'idle', 'drain', or 'mix', which informs users about the availability and functionality of the nodes.

Q/A.question: Based on the provided data, which partition has the highest number of idle nodes?
Q/A.answer: The 'gamma' partition has the highest number of idle nodes, with all 3 nodes in 'idle' state.

Q/A.question: How does the command 'scontrol show nodes' help in managing a cluster?
Q/A.answer: 'scontrol show nodes' helps in managing a cluster by providing detailed information on individual nodes, including CPU allocation, memory usage, and node state.

Q/A.question: What information is retrieved by the command 'sacctmgr list qos format=Name,Priority,MaxWall,MaxJobsPU'?
Q/A.answer: The command retrieves the QoS names, their priority, maximum wall time, and maximum jobs per user.

Q/A.question: What does the term GPU stand for?
Q/A.answer: GPU stands for Graphics Processing Unit.

Q/A.question: List the NVIDIA GPU architectures mentioned in the document from newest to oldest.
Q/A.answer: Hopper, Ada Lovelace, Ampere, Turing, Pascal, Maxwell.

Q/A.question: Why are the exact quantities of GPUs not listed in the document?
Q/A.answer: The exact quantities change frequently due to additions or removals from the cluster or during compute node troubleshooting.

Q/A.question: What command should you use to see which compute nodes have which GPUs?
Q/A.answer: You should use the show_nodes command on a submission or compute node.

Q/A.question: What is the memory bandwidth of the H100 NVLink GPU?
Q/A.answer: The memory bandwidth of the H100 NVLink GPU is 37.87 TB/s.

Q/A.question: How much GPU memory does the RTX A6000 have?
Q/A.answer: The RTX A6000 has 48 GB of GDDR6 memory.

Q/A.question: What is TF32 performance and why is it important?
Q/A.answer: TF32 performance is a type of floating-point performance for tensor operations; it is important for tasks like deep learning and AI training.

Q/A.question: Which GPU has a memory bandwidth of 320 GB/s?
Q/A.answer: The GeForce RTX 3090 has a memory bandwidth of 936 GB/s.

Q/A.question: Identify the GPU with the least FP32 Performance mentioned in the document.
Q/A.answer: The GeForce GTX 1080 Ti has an FP32 performance of 11.3 TFLOPS.

Q/A.question: What is the GRES string for the A100 PCIe 80GB GPU?
Q/A.answer: The GRES string for the A100 PCIe 80GB GPU is 'a100'.

Q/A.question: How many CUDA cores does the A100 SXM 80GB GPU have?
Q/A.answer: The A100 SXM 80GB GPU has 6912 CUDA cores.

Q/A.question: What does the abbreviation 'TFLOPS' stand for?
Q/A.answer: TFLOPS stands for Teraflops, a measure of a computer's performance, especially in floating-point calculations.

Q/A.question: Is the performance information for the H100 NVLink GPU officially published?
Q/A.answer: No, the performance information for the H100 NVLink GPU is not officially published.

Q/A.question: What is the GDDR memory type used by the GeForce RTX 3070?
Q/A.answer: The GeForce RTX 3070 uses 8 GB of GDDR6 memory.

Q/A.question: Explain the significance of NVLink in the context of GPUs discussed.
Q/A.answer: NVLink is a high-speed interconnect technology that connects multiple GPUs, significantly improving communication and performance in multi-GPU configurations.

Q/A.question: What are feature updates and who releases them?
Q/A.answer: Feature updates are designed to bring a large set of new features to all machines that can run Windows. They are typically released annually by Microsoft.

Q/A.question: How does UMIACS manage feature updates for its supported machines?
Q/A.answer: At UMIACS, feature updates are installed on all UMIACS-supported Windows desktops as well as Enterprise supported laptops and home machines via Windows Patch Management.

Q/A.question: Why does UMIACS wait several months to release feature updates after Microsoft releases them?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS typically releases feature updates several months after Microsoft's general public release to ensure that the targeted release is compatible with all software that they run, such as their VPN.

Q/A.question: What are the current feature releases being deployed at UMIACS for Windows 10 and Windows 11?
Q/A.answer: The current feature releases are Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 11 23H2.

Q/A.question: On what date was the current Windows 10 feature release deployed?
Q/A.answer: The current Windows 10 feature release was deployed on March 15th, 2023.

Q/A.question: When is the current Windows 11 feature release scheduled to be deployed?
Q/A.answer: The current Windows 11 feature release is scheduled to be deployed on April 10th, 2024.

Q/A.question: What significant event regarding Windows 10 is mentioned in the UMIACS documentation?
Q/A.answer: Windows 10 reaches end of support on October 14th, 2025.

Q/A.question: What additional resources can be consulted for a comprehensive list of the new features in the Windows 10 feature update?
Q/A.answer: Microsoft's documentation can be consulted at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/whats-new/whats-new-windows-10-version-22h2.

Q/A.question: What happens after a feature update is installed on UMIACS supported machines?
Q/A.answer: After a feature update is installed, additional supplemental updates (e.g., security patches) may need to be installed, which may require additional reboots.

Q/A.question: How are users notified about the installation of feature updates on their machines?
Q/A.answer: Users receive a notification to install the feature update in the same way that other patches are installed.

Q/A.question: What is the design intention behind requiring additional reboots after installing feature updates?
Q/A.answer: The additional reboots after installing feature updates are by design to accommodate the installation of supplemental updates.

Q/A.question: What can you use to change your default shell for new access or specific ComputationalResources?

Q/A.answer: Changing the shell incorrectly may lead to configuration issues, which can disrupt the functioning of services like sftp.

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of Solstice?
Q/A.answer: Solstice is a wireless and content sharing solution that enables multiple users to connect simultaneously to a shared display.

Q/A.question: Which buildings have conference rooms equipped with Solstice Mersive Pods?
Q/A.answer: All conference rooms in the Brendan Iribe Center and some in the Atlantic Building are equipped with Solstice Mersive Pods.

Q/A.question: What is displayed on the Solstice Welcome Screen when there is no current collaboration session?
Q/A.answer: The Welcome Screen contains the Solstice display name, a screen key, network information, user connection instructions, and the Solstice display menu.

Q/A.question: How can a user connect to a Solstice display using the Solstice user app?
Q/A.answer: A user must ensure they are connected to either the UMD wireless or wired network, open the Solstice user app, search for a specific display by name/IP, and enter the screen key when prompted.

Q/A.question: What steps should a user follow to mirror their iOS device screen using AirPlay?
Q/A.answer: The user should ensure their iOS device is on the WiFi network, open the iOS Control Center, tap the Screen Mirroring button, select the desired Solstice display, and enter the screen key if prompted.

Q/A.question: What is required for an Android device to use Miracast for screen sharing?
Q/A.answer: The organization must have enabled streaming with Miracast, and users without the Solstice user app can connect and share their screen via Miracast capabilities on their Windows device.

Q/A.question: Which key combination is used on a Windows laptop to start the mirroring process?
Q/A.answer: The user should hit the Windows key + P.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if the Solstice display does not appear in the AirPlay menu?
Q/A.answer: The user should open the Solstice App, connect to the desired display, and repeat the steps to open the iOS Control Center and select the display.

Q/A.question: How can a user stop mirroring their screen to the display?
Q/A.answer: To stop mirroring, the user should open the iOS Control Center, tap the Airplay button, and then tap Stop Mirroring.

Q/A.question: Explain how users can change the display options during Miracast streaming.
Q/A.answer: Users can hit the Windows key + P to change how their device handles the display, then select one of the available display options.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended setting for Mersive when streaming with Miracast?
Q/A.answer: Mersive recommends using the Duplicate setting when streaming with Miracast.

Q/A.question: What is GNU Screen and what is its primary function?
Q/A.answer: GNU Screen, or 'screen', is a window management program available on UMIACS Linux hosts that allows multiplexing of a single terminal between multiple virtual consoles.

Q/A.question: Why is GNU Screen typically used?
Q/A.answer: Screen is typically used when a network connection is unstable and the process must remain running even if an SSH connection has dropped.

Q/A.question: How can you start a new screen session from the terminal?
Q/A.answer: You can start a new screen session by using the command '# screen'.

Q/A.question: What command can you use to run a program within a new screen session?
Q/A.answer: You can run a program within a new screen session using the command '# screen vi program.c'.

Q/A.question: How can you detach the current screen session?
Q/A.answer: You can detach the current screen session with the command '# screen -d'.

Q/A.question: What command can you use to list currently running screen sessions?
Q/A.answer: To list current screen sessions, you can use the command '# screen -ls'.

Q/A.question: How do you reconnect to a specific screen session?
Q/A.answer: You can reconnect to a specific screen session using either the screen number or name with the command '# screen -r 26598' or '# screen -r screenTest1'.

Q/A.question: What is the metacharacter for commands in screen?
Q/A.answer: Ctrl-A is the metacharacter for commands in screen.

Q/A.question: Which command creates a new window in a screen session?
Q/A.answer: The command 'Ctrl-A + c' creates a new window.

Q/A.question: What happens when you start a screen session that runs a program in a single window?
Q/A.answer: If the program exits, the screen session will terminate as well, potentially hiding any output you may want from the program.

Q/A.question: What file can be used to customize a screen session's startup behavior?
Q/A.answer: The file .screenrc in a user's home directory can be used to customize a screen session's startup behavior.

Q/A.question: What type of information can be displayed by customizing the .screenrc file?
Q/A.answer: The .screenrc file can display information such as the window number and name, the name of the host connected to, or alter key sequences for screen commands.

Q/A.question: Where can you find more information about GNU Screen commands?
Q/A.answer: More information about GNU Screen commands can be found in the GNU Screen documentation at http://www.gnu.org/software/screen/manual/screen.txt.

Q/A.question: What are input method editors (IMEs) primarily used for?
Q/A.answer: IMEs make it easier to type in languages, usually East Asian languages, that are made up of thousands of characters that can't fit on a standard keyboard.

Q/A.question: Can IMEs be added or removed without administrative privileges?
Q/A.answer: Yes, IMEs are a per user setting and can be added, removed, or customized without any need for administrative privileges.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to add an IME on a Windows system?
Q/A.answer: The first step is to click the Windows button and open the control panel.

Q/A.question: Which option do you select in the control panel to change input methods?
Q/A.answer: You select 'Clock, Language, and Region' and then 'Change keyboards or other input methods'.

Q/A.question: What should you do after clicking 'Change Keyboards' in the dialogue box?
Q/A.answer: After that, click the 'Add' button to add a new input method.

Q/A.question: What should you do to enable an IME for a specific language?
Q/A.answer: Scroll through the list of languages until you find the language you want to add, expand the list, then expand the keyboard subtree and check any of the IMEs that you want to enable.

Q/A.question: What button do you click after checking the IMEs you want to enable?
Q/A.answer: You click the 'Ok' button.

Q/A.question: What indicates that a new IME has been successfully set up?
Q/A.answer: A new icon should appear in the bottom right corner of your screen near the taskbar that allows you to switch between IMEs and configure them.

Q/A.question: How can you access help pages for configuring an IME?
Q/A.answer: You can click the Options Menu icon on the right side of the language bar.

Q/A.question: What does SLURM provide when you first submit a job?
Q/A.answer: SLURM provides a job ID which represents the resources allocated to your job.

Q/A.question: What command is used to show job status in the queue?
Q/A.answer: The command used to show job status in the queue is 'squeue'.

Q/A.question: Which flag with the squeue command shows only jobs for a specific user?
Q/A.answer: -u username flag shows only your jobs.

Q/A.question: What does the --start flag do when used with squeue?
Q/A.answer: The --start flag estimates the start time for a job that has not yet started and the reason why it is waiting.

Q/A.question: What information does the sstat command display?
Q/A.answer: The sstat command shows metrics from currently running job steps.

Q/A.question: What is the output if no job steps exist when calling sstat?
Q/A.answer: If you do not have any job steps, sstat will return an error.

Q/A.question: When would you use the sacct command?
Q/A.answer: You would use the sacct command to show metrics from past jobs.

Q/A.question: What command can you use to check why your job is in Pending (PD) status?
Q/A.answer: You can use 'scontrol show job <jobid>' to get all parameters for your job to help identify why it's not running.

Q/A.question: List two common reasons why a job may be in a Pending state.
Q/A.answer: Common reasons include 'Resources' and 'Priority'.

Q/A.question: What does 'ReqNodeNotAvail' mean in the context of job status?
Q/A.answer: 'ReqNodeNotAvail' means that none of the nodes that could run your job currently have the resources to fit your job.

Q/A.question: What is the format for a batch script in SLURM?
Q/A.answer:
The format for a batch script in SLURM is: #!/bin/bash
#SBATCH ...
#SBATCH ...
# set environment up
module load ...
# launch job steps
srun <command to run> # step 1
srun <command to run> # step 2.

Q/A.question: How can you specify the format of the output when using sacct?
Q/A.answer: You can specify the format of the output using the --format option followed by the desired fields.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to check current reservations in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: You would use the 'scontrol show reservation' command to check current reservations.

Q/A.question: In the context of SLURM, what does the exit code '0:0' indicate?
Q/A.answer: The exit code '0:0' indicates that the job completed successfully without errors.

Q/A.question: What command provides a list of job reason codes related to SLURM?
Q/A.answer: The full list of reasons/explanations can be found at 'https://slurm.schedmd.com/job_reason_codes.html'.

Q/A.question: What does 'QOSMax*PerUser' refer to in job limitations?
Q/A.answer: 'QOSMax*PerUser' refers to the quality of service (QoS) limits your job is requesting to use that has some limit per user.

Q/A.answer: It is important because the nfshomes directory stores SSH keys and other authentication-related files.

Q/A.question: What path should users use to access the file system over CIFS?
Q/A.answer: Users should use the path: \\isilondata.umiacs.umd.edu\nfshomes\<username>.

Q/A.question: Who can use CIFS to access the home directory?
Q/A.answer: CIFS access is limited to machines in the domain.

Q/A.question: What should users do to access the home directory from outside the UMIACS network?
Q/A.answer: Users should use the VPN if they need access from outside UMIACS networks.

Q/A.question: What is Open Broadcaster Software (OBS) and what is its primary purpose?
Q/A.answer: Open Broadcaster Software (OBS) is free and open source software for video recording and live streaming.

Q/A.question: What do users at UMIACS recommend for recording or streaming?
Q/A.answer: Users at UMIACS recommend using Open Broadcaster Software (OBS) to record or stream.

Q/A.question: What is the first step outlined in the Conference Quick Setup for recording or streaming?
Q/A.answer: Select the source you'd like to route to the computer via the 'Shared Media' option on the Crestron control panel.

Q/A.question: What should you do after launching OBS on the conference room computer?
Q/A.answer: Do not run the auto-configuration wizard.

Q/A.question: How do you set up video in OBS?
Q/A.answer: Click the + under the Sources pane at the bottom and select Video Capture Device, then leave everything at default and hit OK.

Q/A.question: What should you do if the output appears blurry or fuzzy?
Q/A.answer: Try setting the Resolution/FPS Type to Custom and changing it from Device Default, especially in larger conference rooms and auditoriums.

Q/A.question: What is the default microphone listed under in the mixer pane?
Q/A.answer: The default microphone is listed as Mic/Aux under the Mixer pane.

Q/A.question: How can a user mute Desktop Audio by default?
Q/A.answer: Click the megaphone icon under Desktop Audio to mute it.

Q/A.question: Which services can be selected for streaming in OBS?

Q/A.question: Where can you find your stream key for YouTube?
Q/A.answer: You can find your stream key on the YouTube live dashboard, near the bottom.

Q/A.question: What should the recording path be set to in a conference room?
Q/A.answer: The recording path should be set to an external SSD or the internal drive.

Q/A.question: Why should external HDDs be avoided for recording?
Q/A.answer: Using external HDDs may introduce dropped frames due to encoding lag because of I/O bottlenecks.

Q/A.question: What is Visual Studio Code and who developed it?
Q/A.answer: Visual Studio Code is a multi-platform source-code editor developed by Microsoft.

Q/A.question: Can Visual Studio Code be used with multiple programming languages?
Q/A.answer: Yes, Visual Studio Code can be used with a variety of programming languages.

Q/A.question: What is the base functionality of Visual Studio Code extended through?
Q/A.answer: The base functionality of Visual Studio Code can be extended through extensions available via its marketplace.

Q/A.question: Is Visual Studio Code free, and are there any paid options?
Q/A.answer: The base editor itself is free, but some extensions may require paid subscriptions.

Q/A.question: What is the Remote - SSH extension used for in Visual Studio Code?
Q/A.answer: The Remote - SSH extension is used to connect to a VS Code Server session on submission nodes.

Q/A.question: What should you do if using the Remote - SSH extension impacts other users?
Q/A.answer: You should follow best practices to minimize the chance of impacting others on submission nodes.

Q/A.question: What is a best practice regarding the use of VS Code as a code editor?
Q/A.answer: Use VS Code strictly as a code editor and avoid performing extensive file management operations within it.

Q/A.question: Why should you refrain from opening large files in VS Code on submission nodes?
Q/A.answer: Large files are loaded entirely into RAM on the remote machine, which can cause performance issues and memory retention.

Q/A.question: What alternatives are suggested for handling large files instead of using VS Code?
Q/A.answer: You can use a lighter-weight command-line based text editor like vim or transfer files to a less-used remote machine or your local machine.

Q/A.question: What should you do after using VS Code for an extended period on a submission node?
Q/A.answer: Consider manually killing your server session on the submission node to free up resources.

Q/A.question: How can you clean up your server session in VS Code?
Q/A.answer: Open the Command Palette, search for 'Kill VS Code Server on Host...', select the submission node, and confirm the command.

Q/A.question: What should you check if you encounter issues SSH'ing into a submission node with VS Code?
Q/A.answer: Check if your home directory is full.

Q/A.question: What command can you use to check if your home directory is full?
Q/A.answer: You can use the command 'df -h .' after navigating to your home directory.

Q/A.question: What should you do if your home directory is full?
Q/A.answer: Delete some files to free up at least ~100MB of space before trying to connect with VS Code again.

Q/A.answer: Microsoft has partnered with Canonical, the makers of Ubuntu.

Q/A.question: What functionality does the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) provide?
Q/A.answer: It allows Windows users to use Linux command line tools such as grep, sed, and git on Windows files through Bash.

Q/A.question: What is the minimum Windows version required to install Bash/WSL?
Q/A.answer: You must be running a 64-bit version of Windows 10 version 1607 or later, any version of Windows 11, or Windows Server 2019 or later.

Q/A.answer: Turn on Developer Mode.

Q/A.question: Is the Unix user account created in WSL the same as the Windows user account?

Q/A.question: What should you avoid doing with the Linux files in WSL?

Q/A.answer: Windows storage and files can be accessed from /mnt/..., such as /mnt/c/Users/myAccount.

Q/A.answer: Torch is categorized as a computational framework that is used for machine learning.

Q/A.question: What email services did UMIACS discontinue as of June 30, 2020?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS discontinued its Exchange and IMAP mailbox email services.

Q/A.question: What email did UMIACS send to users on May 1, 2020?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS sent an email with the subject line 'UMIACS Email Migration'.

Q/A.question: What action should individuals take if they did not receive the migration email?
Q/A.answer: Individuals should update their email preference in the Directory app before June 2nd, 2020 at 9am.

Q/A.question: If a user did not have a @umd.edu email address, what happened to their email forward after June 2, 2020?
Q/A.answer: The UMIACS Technical Staff updated their email forward to the last known email address on record.

Q/A.question: How can users update their email forwarding address?
Q/A.answer: Users can log into the Directory app, change the address under the 'Email' section, and click Submit.

Q/A.question: What is required for a user to import email from their previous provider into their UMD mailbox?
Q/A.answer: Users need to follow specific steps as UMIACS staff cannot assist due to lack of administrative access.

Q/A.answer: The archive will be in PST file format.

Q/A.question: What tool do Exchange users need to use to import their email from the PST file?
Q/A.answer: Exchange users need to download and install G Suite Migration for Microsoft Outlook.

Q/A.question: What format will the UMIACS mailbox archive be in for IMAP users?
Q/A.answer: The archive will be in MBOX file format, compressed into a tarball.

Q/A.question: What tool must IMAP users install to import their email from the MBOX files?
Q/A.answer: IMAP users must install Mozilla Thunderbird and the ImportExportTools NG add-on.

Q/A.question: What should users do if they cannot find instructions from their previous email provider?
Q/A.answer: Users can search for instructions that allow them to export email in PST or MBOX formats and follow the steps for Exchange or IMAP to import.

Q/A.question: Who should users contact if they encounter issues while importing email into their UMD mailbox?
Q/A.answer: Users should contact the Division of IT.

Q/A.question: What command is used to specify the number of nodes in the script?
Q/A.answer: #PBS -l nodes=8,walltime=60

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the line 'PATH=/usr/local/stow/mpichgm-1.2.7p1-20/bin:$PATH'?
Q/A.answer: It sets up the environment path to include the directory for the MPICH binaries.

Q/A.question: In the script, what command is used to execute the MPICH program?
Q/A.answer: mpirun -np $( wc -l < $PBS_NODEFILE ) ./alltoall-mpich1

Q/A.question: What does the command 'wc -l < $PBS_NODEFILE' compute?
Q/A.answer: It counts the number of lines in the PBS_NODEFILE, which corresponds to the number of processes to be run.

Q/A.question: Why is the command 'cd ~/mpich1test/' used in this script?
Q/A.answer: It changes the directory to '~/mpich1test/' where the executable program 'alltoall-mpich1' is presumably located.

Q/A.question: Explain the purpose of the '#!/bin/bash' line at the beginning of the script.
Q/A.answer: It indicates that the script should be run in the Bash shell.

Q/A.question: How many nodes does the script allocate for the job?
Q/A.answer: 8 nodes

Q/A.question: What is the expected maximum walltime for the job defined in this script?
What is the significance of the PBS directives in the script?
Q/A.answer: They provide instructions to the PBS job scheduler about resource allocation for the job.

Q/A.question: What happens if the program 'alltoall-mpich1' is not found in the specified directory when the script is run?
Q/A.answer: The execution will fail with an error indicating that the program cannot be found.

Q/A.question: What is BitLocker Drive Encryption?
Q/A.answer: BitLocker Drive Encryption is a data protection feature available in all modern versions of Windows.

Q/A.question: How does BitLocker help protect data on lost or stolen computers?
Q/A.answer: BitLocker helps mitigate unauthorized data access by enhancing file and system protections and rendering data inaccessible when BitLocker-protected computers are decommissioned or recycled.

Q/A.question: What types of machines have BitLocker enabled by UMIACS staff?
Q/A.answer: All supported personal office workstations, as well as enterprise or base-supported laptops and home machines, have BitLocker enabled.

Q/A.question: What might cause BitLocker to prompt for a recovery key?
Q/A.answer: Changes to system boot information, such as BIOS or firmware updates, DVDs or USB drives inserted during boot, or malware on the system may cause BitLocker to prompt for a recovery key.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to take if prompted by BitLocker recovery?
Q/A.answer: The first step should always be to disconnect any external devices and then power the machine off and back on.

Q/A.question: How can a user temporarily suspend BitLocker protection?
Q/A.answer: To temporarily suspend BitLocker protection, search for BitLocker in the Start menu, click on 'Manage BitLocker', then click 'Suspend protection' on the Operating system drive and confirm.

Q/A.question: What should a user do after performing an operation that may trigger BitLocker recovery?
Q/A.answer: After performing the operation, the user should boot back into Windows and click 'Resume protection' to commit the current boot configuration.

Q/A.question: What are some examples of factors that can affect BitLocker functionality?
Q/A.answer: Some examples include BIOS or firmware updates, DVDs or USB drives being plugged in during boot, and malware present on the system.

Q/A.question: Why is it important for BitLocker to be integrated with the operating system?
Q/A.answer: Having BitLocker integrated with the operating system addresses the threats of data theft or exposure from lost, stolen, or inappropriately decommissioned computers.

Q/A.question: If a BitLocker recovery prompt continues to appear after checking external devices, what should a user do?
Q/A.answer: If the prompt still appears, the user should contact UMIACS staff for further troubleshooting.

Q/A.answer: There will be a warning stating that the full installation requires administrative privileges.

Q/A.answer: You can choose an installation folder anywhere within your home directory.

Q/A.answer: The default name for the folder is 'R'.

Q/A.answer: MDI means one main window for all R programs.

Q/A.question: What are the two options available for help format in the customized startup environment?
Q/A.answer: You can choose from plain text format or HTML formatted.

Q/A.question: What is the basis of Windows Authentication as mentioned in the document?
Q/A.answer: Windows Authentication is based on the Kerberos standard authentication with some extensions.

Q/A.question: What are the different places where ActiveDirectory authentication can be used?
Q/A.answer: ActiveDirectory authentication can be used to log in to UMIACS-supported computers, UMIACS-supported web services, and UMIACS VPN.

Q/A.question: How might your account be represented in applications that use ActiveDirectory authentication?
Q/A.answer: Your account might be shown as UMIACS\username or username@ad.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: Can you summarize the key functions of ActiveDirectory as described in the text?
Q/A.answer: ActiveDirectory facilitates authentication for accessing various UMIACS-supported systems and services.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of the Kerberos protocol in Windows Authentication?
Q/A.answer: Kerberos is a standard authentication protocol that underpins Windows Authentication, providing secure authentication methods.

Q/A.question: In what context is the phrase 'Jump to navigation' used in the document?
Q/A.answer: The phrase 'Jump to navigation' is part of the webpage's user interface, allowing users to quickly navigate within the page.

Q/A.question: Why might understanding ActiveDirectory be important for users at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Understanding ActiveDirectory is important for users at UMIACS as it directly affects how they authenticate to various systems and services.

Q/A.question: What is Podman?
Q/A.answer: Podman is a daemonless container engine alternative to Docker.

Q/A.question: Why is Docker not supported in many environments at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Docker is not supported because it grants trivial administrative control over the host the Docker daemon runs on.

Q/A.question: How does Podman enhance security compared to Docker?
Q/A.answer: Podman can run containers in user namespaces, meaning that processes in a user namespace map to a new uid/gid range, preventing root in a container from being uid 0 outside the container.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended container engine for running containerized workloads on clustered resources according to the document?
Q/A.answer: The recommended container engine for running containerized workloads on clustered resources is Apptainer.

Q/A.question: What command should you run to verify Podman is installed and configured correctly?
Q/A.answer: You should run the command 'podman'.

Q/A.question: What error indicates that no subuid ranges were found for a user?
Q/A.answer: The error 'cannot find mappings for user username: No subuid ranges found for user "username" in /etc/subuid' indicates that no subuid ranges were found.

Q/A.question: Where are container image layers stored by default?
Q/A.answer: Container image layers are stored in the graphroot setting of ~/.config/containers/storage.conf, which is typically in the home directory.

Q/A.question: What should be done if the default directory for 'imageCopyTmpDir' fills up?
Q/A.answer: If the default directory for 'imageCopyTmpDir' fills up, you need to specify a different directory using the environment variable TMPDIR.

Q/A.question: What additional configuration is required to run Podman with local Nvidia GPUs?
Q/A.answer: You need to ensure that the nvidia-container-runtime package is installed.

Q/A.question: How can you run nvidia-smi from within an Nvidia CUDA container using Podman?
Q/A.answer: You can run it with a command like '$ podman run --rm --hooks-dir=/usr/share/containers/oci/hooks.d docker.io/nvidia/cuda:12.2.2-base-ubi8 nvidia-smi'.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to clone the gpudocker repository?
Q/A.answer: You would use the command 'git clone https://gitlab.umiacs.umd.edu/derek/gpudocker.git'.

Q/A.question: What command is used to build the image from the gpudocker repository?
Q/A.answer: You would use 'podman build -t gpudocker .' to build the image.

Q/A.question: What does the command 'podman run --volume `pwd`/test:/mnt --hooks-dir=/usr/share/containers/oci/hooks.d gpudocker python3 /mnt/test_torch.py' do?
Q/A.answer: This command runs the GPUDocker image and executes a Python script located in the mounted test directory.

Q/A.question: If you want to push modifications of the example to your own container registry, where can you find instructions?
Q/A.answer: Instructions can be found in the README.md located in the example repository.

Q/A.question: What is Remote Desktop and what allows you to do?
Q/A.answer: Remote Desktop allows you to connect to another computer over a compatible network, controlling the Windows desktop environment through a graphical user interface.

Q/A.question: Which operating systems currently support Remote Desktop at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Currently, Remote Desktop at UMIACS is only supported for Windows hosts using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

Q/A.question: What must you be on to access an RDP enabled machine?
Q/A.answer: You must be on the UMIACS physical network or VPN.

Q/A.question: What may happen if a remote session is already active and another user attempts to log in?
Q/A.answer: If a remote session is active, another user cannot log onto the physical console, and attempting to use RDP when a computer is already in use could force the existing user to log off, potentially losing their work.

Q/A.question: What is the first step for connecting to a Windows machine over RDP?
Q/A.answer: The first step is to start the 'Remote Desktop Connection' client from the 'Start' menu of Windows.

Q/A.question: What format should the UMIACS username be when entering credentials?
Q/A.answer: The username must be in the format UMIACS\username, with a backslash.

Q/A.question: How do you initiate a connection to a Windows host using the Remote Desktop client?
Q/A.answer: You type the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FDQN) of the desired Windows host in the client after starting it, then click 'Connect'.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you see an identity verification failure warning for UMIACS machines?
Q/A.answer: You can ignore the warning and proceed by checking the box and selecting 'Yes'.

Q/A.question: What should you do to log off from a remote session?
Q/A.answer: You should log out of Windows on the remote computer to terminate the session.

Q/A.question: What is the preferred application for connecting to a Windows client from macOS?
Q/A.answer: The preferred application for connecting to a Windows client from macOS is the 'Microsoft Remote Desktop' application.

Q/A.question: In UNIX, which command should you use to connect to a Windows host via RDP on Ubuntu?
Q/A.answer: You should use the 'rdesktop' command with the appropriate parameters.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the clipboard redirection option in RDP?
Q/A.answer: Clipboard redirection allows you to transfer the clipboard content between the remote and current host while the RDP client is running.

Q/A.question: What steps should you take to redirect audio resources on Windows?
Q/A.answer: You should open 'Show Options', navigate to the 'Local Resources' tab, click 'Settings' in the Remote audio box, select your audio preferences, and then click 'OK' and 'Connect'.

Q/A.question: What must you check if you want to redirect specific local folders to a remote machine on a Mac?
Q/A.answer: You must check the box titled 'Redirect folders' and select the folders you wish to access or select the '+' button to import folders.

Q/A.question: How do you set up resource redirection before connecting with RDP?
Q/A.answer: Resource redirection must be set up in the options before the connection to the remote host is established.

Q/A.question: In the case of using xfreerdp, what does the '-d UMIACS' parameter indicate?
Q/A.answer: -d UMIACS indicates the domain to which the UMIACS username belongs while connecting.

Q/A.question: What is Jekyll?
Q/A.answer: Jekyll is a blog-aware, static site generator.

Q/A.question: How does Jekyll differ from many CMS solutions?
Q/A.answer: Jekyll does not rely on a serverside scripting language and a database; it allows you to deploy your site to any web tree that can serve static files.

Q/A.question: What languages and data formats does Jekyll use for site design?
Q/A.answer: Jekyll provides a templating language and data format that allows design using HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the separation of design and content in Jekyll?
Q/A.answer: The separation allows for easy editing and reuse of your own custom design templates and those made by others.

Q/A.question: What happens when you are ready to update the content in Jekyll?
Q/A.answer: Jekyll compiles your templates and content files into full HTML.

Q/A.question: Can you name a site that is an example of a Jekyll-generated site?
Q/A.answer: A great example of a Jekyll-generated site is the UMIACS Intranet page.

Q/A.question: What instructions are taken from the official Jekyll quickstart guide?
Q/A.answer: The instructions include installing all the prerequisites to run Jekyll, installing the jekyll and bundler gems, creating a new Jekyll site, changing into your new directory, building the site, and making it available on a local server.

Q/A.question: What command is used to create a new Jekyll site?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'jekyll new mysite'.

Q/A.question: What command do you use to build the Jekyll site and serve it locally?
Q/A.answer: You use the command 'bundle exec jekyll serve'.

Q/A.question: What URL do you browse to access your Jekyll site on a local server?
Q/A.answer: You browse to http://localhost:4000.

Q/A.question: Where can you find instructions to publish a Jekyll site?
Q/A.answer: Instructions to publish a Jekyll site can be found at https://gitlab.umiacs.umd.edu/docker/jekyll-builder.

Q/A.question: What feature does the Object Store provide for publishing Jekyll sites?
Q/A.answer: The Object Store can be configured to publish automatically every time you push updates to GitLab.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of the services provided by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The primary purpose of the services provided by UMIACS is to help further the research of its members.

Q/A.question: What are the main categories of services offered by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The main categories of services offered by UMIACS include Computational Resources, Common-Pool Resources, Electronic Mail, Equipment Loans, Logistics, On-Site Services, Technical Support, Web-based Collaborative Tools, and Web Hosting.

Q/A.question: What types of resources are included under the 'Computational Resources' category?
Q/A.answer: The 'Computational Resources' category includes Workstations, Laptops, HPC (High-Performance Computing), and Virtualization.

Q/A.question: What services are provided under 'Data Storage and Backup'?
Q/A.answer: Services under 'Data Storage and Backup' assist with data management and distribution.

Q/A.question: What types of services are included in the 'E-Mail' category?
Q/A.answer: The 'E-Mail' category includes locally hosted E-Mail services.

Q/A.question: What can be loaned through the 'Equipment Loans' category?
Q/A.answer: Through the 'Equipment Loans' category, Laptops, Projectors, and Data Storage can be loaned.

Q/A.question: What does the 'Logistics' category cover regarding services?
Q/A.answer: The 'Logistics' category covers services related to Ordering, Procurement, and Receiving.

Q/A.question: What kinds of support are offered in the 'Technical Support' category?
Q/A.answer: The 'Technical Support' category offers hardware and OS support.

Q/A.question: What tools are provided for collaboration in the 'Web-based Collaborative Tools' category?
Q/A.answer: The 'Web-based Collaborative Tools' category includes tools for Revision Control and Data Sharing.

Q/A.question: What are the offerings in the 'Web Hosting' category?
Q/A.answer: The 'Web Hosting' category offers User Webspace, Lab Webspace, and Project Pages.

Q/A.question: What email address format should you use to log in to the Barracuda Spam Firewall system?
Q/A.answer: You should use the format username@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What are the two URLs provided for accessing the spam quarantine?
Q/A.answer: The two URLs are bubs.umiacs.umd.edu and pompom.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What three filters can be used when searching the spam quarantine?
Q/A.answer: The three filters are 'from', 'subject', and 'message'.

Q/A.question: How does the 'from' filter work in the spam quarantine search?
Q/A.answer: The 'from' filter allows you to search for emails based on who sent them.

Q/A.question: What options do you have for filtering when searching by subject?
Q/A.answer: You can select 'contains' or 'doesn't contain' when filtering by subject.

Q/A.question: If you select the 'contains' option and search for 'binary' in the subject filter, what will the results show?
Q/A.answer: The results will show all emails that have 'binary' in the subject.

Q/A.question: What type of search will be shown if you select 'doesn't contain' and search for 'binary'?
Q/A.answer: It will show all emails that do not have 'binary' in the subject.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of the page titled 'Iribe/ConferenceRooms/Reserve'?
Q/A.answer: The page shows how to reserve rooms through Google Calendar.

Q/A.question: Which type of accounts are required to schedule rooms on this page?
Q/A.answer: Only UMD accounts with the @umd.edu email address can schedule rooms.

Q/A.question: What happens if a user tries to use a Terpmail account for room reservation?
Q/A.answer: Terpmail accounts will not work for scheduling rooms; only @umd.edu accounts are valid.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to reserve a room according to the document?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to https://calendar.google.com and ensure you are logged into your UMD account.

Q/A.question: What specific information must be included when adding an account to Google Calendar?
Q/A.answer: You must provide your UMD username followed by @umd.edu, for example, username@umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What should a user do to create an event for a room reservation?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Create' to start adding event details.

Q/A.question: How can users search for rooms when scheduling an event?
Q/A.answer: Users can search for rooms by clicking the 'Rooms' tab on the right.

Q/A.question: What indicates that a room is not available for reservation?
Q/A.answer: Rooms that appear with strikethrough text are not available for the selected time.

Q/A.question: What is the final step to complete a reservation after selecting a room?
Q/A.answer: Hit 'Save' to create the reservation.

Q/A.question: What happens if a reservation is made for a moderated room?
Q/A.answer: An email for approval will be sent to the moderator(s) and the reservation is not valid until approved.

Q/A.question: What is the difference in the reservation process between moderated rooms and auto-accept rooms?
Q/A.answer: For moderated rooms, approval is needed for validity, while auto-accept rooms are valid immediately.

Q/A.question: Where can users find instructions for adding an account if needed?
Q/A.answer: Google has instructions available at their support page.

Q/A.question: What type of printer is mentioned in the document?
Q/A.answer: The document mentions the HP LaserJet Enterprise Flow MFP M633.

Q/A.question: What is the fax number associated with the faxing capability of the printer?
Q/A.answer: The fax number is 301-314-9115 (x49115).

Q/A.question: Where is the HP LaserJet Enterprise Flow MFP M633 located?
Q/A.answer: It is located in room 4208 in the Iribe Center.

Q/A.question: What additional capability does the HP LaserJet Enterprise Flow MFP M633 have apart from printing?
Q/A.answer: It has faxing capability configured, both for sending and receiving faxes.

Q/A.question: What should you do before dialing external fax numbers from the HP LaserJet printer?
Q/A.answer: You will need to dial 9 and then 1 before faxing to any number external to the university.

Q/A.question: Where can you find HP's guide for using the fax model?
Q/A.answer: HP's guide for using this model can be found on page 15 of the manual at the link provided.

Q/A.question: Which syntax applies when using the fax machine at UMD?
Q/A.answer: UMD phone syntax still applies when using this machine.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of 'ps432-4208' in this context?
Q/A.answer: 'ps432-4208' is the label assigned to the HP LaserJet Enterprise Flow MFP M633 in room 4208.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the provided external links in the document?
Q/A.answer: The external links provide additional information, such as the guide for the fax machine and UMD phone dialing instructions.

Q/A.question: Can the HP LaserJet Enterprise Flow MFP M633 send and receive faxes?
Q/A.answer: Yes, it can send and receive faxes.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the multi-factor authentication (MFA) rollout by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: To provide better account and data security when using SSH to connect to public-facing hosts.

Q/A.question: What types of authentication methods does SSH support on internal hosts?
Q/A.answer: Interactive password authentication and public key authentication.

Q/A.question: Which authentication method is supported for SSH on UMIACS's public-facing hosts?
Q/A.answer: Only interactive password authentication with a secondary factor from the Duo instance.

Q/A.question: What happens if you connect to the UMIACS VPN before using SSH?
Q/A.answer: You will not need to multi-factor authenticate when using SSH, as the VPN already requires multi-factor authentication.

Q/A.question: Are U2F hardware tokens supported for SSH login at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: No, U2F hardware tokens registered with Duo are not supported for SSH login.

Q/A.question: What is the first step in the example for connecting via SSH to a host with MFA enabled?
Q/A.answer: You enter the command to connect to a host, such as 'ssh username@nexusgroup00.umiacs.umd.edu'.

Q/A.question: What notification options does the Duo two-factor login present after entering a password?
Q/A.answer: Duo Push to a registered phone or iPad, phone call, SMS passcodes, or entering a code.

Q/A.question: What occurs when you select the 'Duo Push' option?
Q/A.answer: A push notification is sent to the Duo app on the registered device for authentication.

Q/A.question: What is required when using the 'Phone call' option for Duo two-factor login?
Q/A.answer: You must answer the call and press any key on your phone to proceed.

Q/A.question: What does selecting 'SMS passcodes' do?
Q/A.answer: It sends a one-time passcode to your registered phone via SMS.

Q/A.question: How can users authenticate using a YubiKey?
Q/A.answer: By tapping the YubiKey, it emits a code automatically.

Q/A.question: After completing the Duo authentication process, what feedback do you get?
Q/A.answer: You are logged in and can operate as normal.

Q/A.question: What should users do if they anticipate needing to SSH to several different hosts?
Q/A.answer: Establish a connection over the UMIACS VPN first to avoid additional MFA steps.

Q/A.question: What is the benefit of using a terminal multiplexer like Screen or Tmux?
Q/A.answer: It minimizes the number of times you need to multi-factor authenticate by allowing multiple processes in one terminal display.

Q/A.question: What happens to subsequent SSH attempts from an already connected window?
Q/A.answer: They will not require multi-factor authentication, as the traffic origin is within the UMIACS border.

Q/A.question: What service has replaced the UMIACS FTP service?
Q/A.answer: The UMIACS Object Store has replaced the FTP service.

Q/A.question: What does FTP stand for?
Q/A.answer: FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol.

Q/A.question: Are internal UMIACS users able to authenticate with their accounts over FTP?
Q/A.answer: No, internal UMIACS users will never authenticate over FTP with their UMIACS account.

Q/A.question: How do external users access the FTP service?
Q/A.answer: External users login to the FTP service as anonymous.

Q/A.question: What should users refer to for more information on secure file transfers?
Q/A.answer: Users should see SFTP for more information on a secure file transfer protocol.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the public FTP space?
Q/A.answer: The public FTP space allows users to place data to be externally accessible.

Q/A.question: What is the file path format for public FTP space from supported UNIX machines?
Q/A.answer: The file path format for public FTP space from supported UNIX machines is /fs/ftp/pub/<username>.

Q/A.question: What is the file path for Windows machines to access the public FTP space?
Q/A.answer: For Windows machines, the file path is umiacs-webftp\ftp-umiacs\pub\<username>.

Q/A.question: What should users do to upload data to their public site?
Q/A.answer: Users can upload data to either /fs/ftp/pub/<username> or umiacs-webftp\ftp-umiacs\pub\<username>.

Q/A.question: Why is it important that FTP is conducted entirely in plaintext?
Q/A.answer: It is important because plaintext means that any data transferred can potentially be intercepted and read by others.

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of the touch panel in the ATL 3100A conference room?
Q/A.answer: The touch panel is used to control the video and audio source(s) and level(s) being used to project to the displays in the room.

Q/A.question: What types of sources are available in the ATL 3100A conference room?
Q/A.answer: The sources available are a Room PC ('PC Main'), a Solstice Pod ('Solstice'), and an HDMI cable for a laptop or external device ('Laptop').

Q/A.question: How can a user prevent echoing during teleconferences in ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: To prevent echoing, the user should leave 'Laptop' as the source video and switch the audio override to 'PC Main' so that the room microphones can pick up the audience while using the laptop for display.

Q/A.question: What must a user do after using the Room PC in ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: The user must log off from the Conference account after use, as the account is fully wiped upon logging off.

Q/A.question: What instructions does the Solstice Pod provide in ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: The Solstice Pod prompts the user to check the display in the room for instructions on how to wirelessly display their device(s).

Q/A.question: How should a user connect their laptop to the display in ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: The user should connect their device to the HDMI cable coming out of the middle of the desk in the room.

Q/A.question: What is the procedure for shutting down the A/V system in ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: The user should touch the 'Shutdown A/V System' button to save energy and ensure the next group has a clean slate, which will turn off the displays and raise the projector screen.

Q/A.question: Are there any simplified controls in the other conference rooms mentioned?
Q/A.answer: Yes, the other conference rooms have simplified touch panels to control the video source and adjust the audio level for the display.

Q/A.question: What is different about the Room PC in the simplified conference rooms compared to ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: The Room PC in the simplified conference rooms is referred to as 'Dedicated PC', while in ATL 3100A it is called 'PC Main'.

Q/A.question: What should you select to turn off the display in the other conference rooms?
Q/A.answer: In the other conference rooms, the user should touch the 'System Power' button and select 'Power Off' to turn off the display.

Q/A.question: What is the first step in changing file or directory permissions in Windows?
Q/A.answer: Right-click the file or directory you would like to change permissions for and click on 'Properties.'

Q/A.question: In the example provided, what is the name of the folder whose permissions are being changed?
Q/A.answer: "ExampleFolder"

Q/A.question: Who is the owner of 'ExampleFolder' in the example?
Q/A.answer: "GenericUser"

Q/A.question: Which user has been granted permissions to 'ExampleFolder'?
Q/A.answer: "Example"

Q/A.question: Which tab must be selected to change permissions after opening the properties menu?
Q/A.answer: 'Security'

Q/A.question: What should you select after clicking on the 'Security' tab to access advanced options?
Q/A.answer: Click on the button labeled 'Advanced' at the bottom of the menu.

Q/A.question: What action do you take to edit user permissions in the advanced settings?
Q/A.answer: Select the user you would like to change permissions for, and select 'Edit'.

Q/A.question: What additional option can you select to view more granular permissions?
Q/A.answer: Select 'Show Advanced permissions'.

Q/A.question: What is the final step to apply all changes made to the permissions?
Q/A.answer: Click the 'OK' or 'Apply' button at the bottom of each menu as necessary.

Q/A.question: What does applying or denying permissions for each user necessitate?
Q/A.answer: It requires selecting the permissions you would like the user to have.

Q/A.question: What major change occurred regarding CLIP's compute nodes in late 2022?
Q/A.answer: The previous standalone cluster for CLIP's compute nodes have folded into Nexus.

Q/A.question: What funding supports the compute resources for Nexus?
Q/A.answer: The compute resources are made possible through college-level funding for UMIACS and CSD faculty.

Q/A.question: Which two submission hosts can you SSH into for Nexus CLIP?
Q/A.answer: The submission hosts are nexusclip00.umiacs.umd.edu and nexusclip01.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What is necessary to access data stored in local directories on the submission hosts?
Q/A.answer: You need to connect to the same submission host you used to store the data.

Q/A.question: What is the naming convention for compute nodes in the CLIP partition?
Q/A.answer: The compute nodes are named clip##.

Q/A.question: What specific job QoS is available for longer jobs using higher overall resources?
Q/A.answer: The additional job QoS is called 'huge-long'.

Q/A.question: What commands must be specified to submit jobs to the CLIP partition?
Q/A.answer: You must specify --partition=clip and --account=clip.

Q/A.question: What does the GrpTRES limit for the CLIP partition include?
Q/A.answer: The GrpTRES limit includes 100% of the available cores/RAM on the partition-specific nodes plus 50% of the available cores/RAM on legacy## nodes in aggregate.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of the job ID in the scontrol show job command?
Q/A.answer: The job ID is used to retrieve specific information about the job when using the scontrol command.

Q/A.question: What can CLIP users request in addition to using the available data filesystems?
Q/A.answer: CLIP users can also request Nexus project allocations.

Q/A.question: What are the two ways to connect a device to the office TVs?
Q/A.answer: VGA cable and HDMI cable.

Q/A.question: What is the main difference between HDMI and VGA connections?
Q/A.answer: HDMI transfers sound natively, while VGA requires an additional 3.5mm audio cable.

Q/A.question: What should you do if your device does not automatically appear on the TV?
Q/A.answer: You may need to turn on the TV or adjust the input of the TV using the remote.

Q/A.question: Where can you obtain a remote for the TV if you do not have one?
Q/A.answer: From the UMIACS Help Desk.

Q/A.question: What is the appropriate input to select on the TV when connecting via HDMI?
Q/A.answer: HDMI 1.

Q/A.question: What are the two display modes available when connecting your device to the TV?
Q/A.answer: Mirror and Extend.

Q/A.question: Explain the 'Mirror' display mode.
Q/A.answer: It displays the same screen on both your computer and the TV.

Q/A.question: What is required to display still images or play a slideshow on the TV?
Q/A.answer: A remote control and a USB flash drive.

Q/A.question: What steps should you take to display images from a USB on the TV?
Q/A.answer: Upload images to a flash drive, plug the drive into the USB port on the TV, select the proper source on the remote, and navigate to the USB in the menu.

Q/A.question: How can you change the slideshow speed and effects on the TV?
Q/A.answer: By clicking the options dropdown in the top right of the file explorer.

Q/A.question: How much space is available on the TV for uploading files from your USB?
Describe the process to upload images from a USB to the TV's internal memory.
Q/A.answer: Navigate to the options menu, select Send, choose images, click Send, and then select Internal Memory.

Q/A.question: What should you do to display an image in fullscreen from the USB?
Q/A.answer: Click on a picture after navigating to it.

Q/A.question: What action will occur if you have more than one picture in the same directory while using the TV?
Q/A.answer: It will automatically start playing a slideshow.

Q/A.question: What components are necessary to connect a laptop to the office TVs?
Q/A.answer: A VC cable or HDMI cable, and possibly an adapter.

Q/A.answer: To provide information about the University of Maryland Institute for Advanced Computer Studies.

Q/A.question: What can be inferred about the relationship between UMIACS and the University of Maryland?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS is an institute affiliated with the University of Maryland that focuses on advanced computer studies.

Q/A.question: What should you do first before starting a Zoom meeting?
Q/A.answer: You should log into your account using the conference room PC.

Q/A.question: What happens if you leave the Conference Room PC without signing out?
Q/A.answer: The PC will automatically sign out after 8 hours of inactivity.

Q/A.question: How do you select the Conference account on the conference room PC?
Q/A.answer: Click the mouse or press ENTER after the Windows login screen appears.

Q/A.question: What is the importance of signing out after your session?
Q/A.answer: To ensure that your session does not remain active and that no one else can access your account.

Q/A.question: What option should you select to log into Zoom using your UMD credentials?
Q/A.answer: 'Sign in with SSO' on the right side of the login window.

Q/A.question: How do you join an existing Zoom meeting?
Q/A.answer: Click on 'Join' on the Zoom home page and enter the meeting ID or personal link provided by the host.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to starting a new Zoom meeting?
Q/A.answer: Click on 'New Meeting' in the Zoom home page.

Q/A.question: What should you do to invite others to your Zoom meeting?
Q/A.answer: Click on 'participants' in the meeting, then click 'invite' at the bottom of the participants window and use 'Copy Invitation'.

Q/A.question: How can you connect Zoom audio using the lectern microphone?

Q/A.question: What do you need to do to display video from a personal laptop in the Zoom meeting?
Q/A.answer: Plug in your laptop to one of the lectern cables, select 'laptop', and route it to shared video and/or projector or monitor.

Q/A.question: What is the final step after finishing a Zoom meeting?
