Q/A.question: What significant change occurred to the MC2 compute nodes in mid 2022?
Q/A.answer: The previous standalone cluster for MC2's compute nodes folded into Nexus.

Q/A.question: What is required to log in to a submission host for the Nexus MC2 cluster?
Q/A.answer: You can SSH to nexusmc2.umiacs.umd.edu to log in to a submission host.

Q/A.question: What must you do to access data stored in a local directory on a submission host?
Q/A.answer: You will need to connect to the same submission host where the data was stored.

Q/A.question: What are the names of the actual submission hosts mentioned for Nexus MC2?
Q/A.answer: The actual submission hosts are nexusmc200.umiacs.edu and nexusmc201.umiacs.edu.

Q/A.question: What types of jobs do MC2 users have access to within the MC2 partition?
Q/A.answer: MC2 users have access to all standard job QoSes in the MC2 partition using the mc2 account.

Q/A.question: What are the two additional jobs QoSes available specifically for the MC2 partition?
Q/A.answer: The additional jobs QoSes are highmem and huge-long.

Q/A.question: What does the highmem QoS allow?
Q/A.answer: The highmem QoS allows for significantly increased memory to be allocated.

Q/A.question: What specific command must you include to submit jobs to the MC2 partition?
Q/A.answer: You need to specify --partition=mc2 and --account=mc2.

Q/A.question: In the job submission example, what was the job ID assigned?
Q/A.answer: The job ID assigned was 218874.

Q/A.question: What was the state of job 218874 after it was allocated resources?
Q/A.answer: The state of job 218874 was RUNNING.

Q/A.question: What is the time limit imposed on jobs submitted to the MC2 partition?
Q/A.answer: The time limit is 1 day (1-00:00:00).

Q/A.question: Which data filesystems are available to MC2 users in Nexus?
Q/A.answer: All data filesystems that were available in the standalone MC2 cluster are also available in Nexus.

Q/A.question: Can MC2 users request Nexus project allocations?
Q/A.answer: Yes, MC2 users can request Nexus project allocations.

Q/A.question: What is the role of college-level funding in the resources available for the Nexus cluster?
Q/A.answer: The Nexus cluster has a large pool of compute resources made possible through college-level funding for UMIACS and CSD faculty.

Q/A.question: What information can be found in the Tron partition of the Nexus cluster?
Q/A.answer: Details on common nodes already in the cluster can be found in the Tron partition.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of SSH jumphosting?
Q/A.answer: The main purpose of SSH jumphosting is to facilitate access to another host through a middle host, allowing users to connect without repeatedly SSH-ing manually from one host to another.

Q/A.question: Describe the format for using dynamic jumphosts.
Q/A.answer: The basic format for jumphosting with dynamic jumphosts is ssh -J user1@host1:port1 user2@host2:port2. If the ports are the same, the format can be simplified to ssh -J user1@host1 user2@host2.

Q/A.question: In what scenarios are dynamic jumphosts most beneficial?
Q/A.answer: Dynamic jumphosts are most useful when the user only needs to make the jump once or infrequently.

Q/A.question: What configuration is required to set up static jumphosts?
Q/A.answer: To set up static jumphosts, you must edit your ~/.ssh/config file to create shortcuts for the jumphosts.

Q/A.question: How do you declare a jumphost in the ~/.ssh/config file?
Q/A.answer: You declare a jumphost in the ~/.ssh/config file with entries like Host directJump followed by HostName and ProxyJump configurations for subsequent jumps.

Q/A.question: How can additional jumps be configured in the ~/.ssh/config file?
Q/A.answer: Additional jumps can be configured by adding more Host entries followed by HostName and ProxyJump directives for each subsequent jump needed.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to access a final host after setting up the jumphosts?
Q/A.answer: After setting up the jumphosts, you can access the final host using the command ssh finalJump.

Q/A.question: What are the characteristics of static jumphosts?
Q/A.answer: Static jumphosts are used when you will often need to make the jump and allow for a shorter, simpler command compared to the longer format used for dynamic jumphosts.

Q/A.question: Can you jumphost through multiple hosts in one command? If so, provide an example.
Q/A.answer: Yes, you can jumphost through multiple hosts in one command. An example format is ssh -J user1@host1:port1,user2@host2:port2 user3@host3.

Q/A.question: What information is required to be defined in the ~/.ssh/config file for static jumphosts?
Q/A.answer: You need to define the Host, HostName, and ProxyJump for the jumphosts that will be used.

Q/A.question: What are the two main configuration files for Tcsh?
Q/A.answer: ~/.tcshrc and ~/.cshrc

Q/A.question: In which order does Tcsh source its configuration files?
Q/A.answer: It sources ~/.tcshrc first if it is found, otherwise it sources ~/.cshrc.

Q/A.question: What command should you type to get a complete explanation of Tcsh features?
Q/A.answer: man tcsh

Q/A.question: What type of documentation is available for Tcsh online?
Q/A.answer: The online TCSH documentation can be found at http://www.tcsh.org/tcsh.html/top.html.

Q/A.question: How can you view your current paths in Tcsh?
Q/A.answer: By typing echo $PATH in the terminal.

Q/A.question: How can you add an additional path to the existing PATH variable in Tcsh?
Q/A.answer: By using the command setenv PATH ${PATH}:/my/new/path.

Q/A.question: What happens if you move around the ${PATH} variable?
Q/A.answer: By moving around ${PATH}, you can put the path at the front or back of the list, as programs are looked up left to right in the path.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Tcsh configuration files?
Q/A.answer: They are used to configure the behavior and environment settings for the Tcsh shell.

Q/A.question: What directories does the example mention could be referenced?
Q/A.answer: The directory .snapshot could also be .zfs/snapshot depending on the filer serving your host.

Q/A.question: What command is suggested to check for directory existence?
Q/A.answer: You can try to ls -l one and if it doesn't exist, try the other.

Q/A.question: What is the username of the user logged into the host in this example?
Q/A.answer: The username is 'username'.

Q/A.question: In which directory does the virtual environment exist?
Q/A.answer: The virtual environment directory named virtualenv exists in the home directory.

Q/A.question: What Python file exists in the directory according to the output of the ls command?
Q/A.answer: The Python file named virtualenv.py exists in the directory.

Q/A.question: What command is used to remove the virtualenv.py file?
Q/A.answer: The command used is 'rm virtualenv.py'.

Q/A.question: Which command verifies that the file has been removed?
Q/A.answer: The command 'ls' is used to verify that the file is removed.

Q/A.question: What is the name of the most recent weekly snapshot directory mentioned?
Q/A.answer: The most recent weekly snapshot directory mentioned is Weekly_nfshomes_2024-06-23_00:00.

Q/A.question: What command is used to change the directory into the snapshot?
Q/A.answer: The command used is 'cd /nfshomes/username/.snapshot/Weekly_nfshomes_2024-06-23_00:00/virtualenv'.

Q/A.question: After restoring the virtualenv.py file, what command confirms its existence in the original directory?
Q/A.answer: The command 'ls' confirms that the file is restored from the snapshot.

Q/A.question: What is the size of the virtualenv.py file as shown in the ls -lah output?
Q/A.answer: The size of the virtualenv.py file is 98K.

Q/A.question: What command is used to copy the virtualenv.py file back to the original directory?
Q/A.answer: The command used is 'cp virtualenv.py /nfshomes/username/virtualenv/'.

Q/A.question: What indicates that the virtualenv.py file still exists in the snapshot?
Q/A.answer: The command 'ls' shows that the file exists in the snapshot directory.

Q/A.question: What file management operations are demonstrated in this wiki example?
Q/A.answer: The operations demonstrated include removing a file, verifying its removal, copying a file back from a snapshot, and confirming its restoration.

Q/A.question: What does 'ls -lah virtualenv.py' output show about the file permissions?
Q/A.answer: The output shows that the permissions are '-rwxrwxr-x', indicating that the owner and group have read, write, and execute permissions, while others have read and execute permissions.

Q/A.question: What is required for all accounts in the Nexus?
Q/A.answer: All accounts in the Nexus are required to be sponsored.

Q/A.question: How can new accounts be requested?
Q/A.answer: New accounts can be requested via the Requests application.

Q/A.question: What should faculty members use as the Principal Investigator when requesting an account?
Q/A.answer: Faculty members should use the username of the current Director of Computing Facilities at UMIACS as the Principal Investigator.

Q/A.question: Who is the current Director of Computing Facilities at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The current Director of Computing Facilities at UMIACS is derek.

Q/A.question: What happens after submitting the account request form?
Q/A.answer: You will be required to verify the email address listed as your external contact, and then the Director of Computing Facilities will approve sponsorship of the account.

Q/A.question: How long does it take for an account to be installed after approval?
Q/A.answer: The account will be installed within 24 business hours (9am-5pm M-F).

Q/A.question: What can faculty do after receiving an account?
Q/A.answer: Faculty can let their students know to request an account listing them as the Principal Investigator.

Q/A.question: What must students or collaborators do when directed by a faculty member?

Q/A.question: What should be used as the Principal Investigator by students or collaborators?
Q/A.answer: They should use the UMIACS account username of the UMIACS or CSD faculty member as the Principal Investigator.

Q/A.question: What happens if a faculty sponsor leaves UMIACS or revokes sponsorship?
Q/A.answer: You will be given 30 days to find a new account sponsor, after which your account will be archived and removed.

Q/A.question: What types of data storage devices will UMIACS Staff securely destroy?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS Staff will securely destroy data storage devices such as hard drives, USB sticks, and CD/DVDs.

Q/A.question: What service is used for the secure destruction of data storage devices at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The service used is the Storage Device Destruction Service provided by the Division of Information Technology.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you want a device securely destroyed by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: You should stop by the help desk to request the secure destruction of your device.

Q/A.question: What must be followed if you plan to destroy a university-owned data storage device yourself?
Q/A.answer: You must be aware of the University's Data Retention Guidelines.

Q/A.question: What is recommended when physically destroying a data storage device?
Q/A.answer: Physical destruction is always recommended when possible, adhering to guidelines published by NIST.

Q/A.question: Where can you find the guidelines published by NIST for data destruction?
Q/A.answer: The guidelines can be found in the document NIST Special Publication 800-88.

Q/A.question: What is advised to do when UMIACS acquires enough devices for destruction?
Q/A.answer: When UMIACS acquires enough devices, they will schedule a mass destruction dropoff.

Q/A.question: What action is associated with the destruction process of storage devices at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Devices are placed in a pile to be sent off for secure destruction.

Q/A.question: What should one be aware of regarding the destruction of personal data storage devices?
Q/A.answer: One should be aware of the University's Data Retention Guidelines when destroying university-owned devices.

Q/A.question: What does UMIACS likely do with devices destined for destruction?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS likely collects and securely stores these devices before sending them off for destruction.

Q/A.question: What are users responsible for when submitting to a partition eligible for preemption?
Q/A.answer: Users are responsible for making sure that their job can be interrupted/restarted gracefully.

Q/A.question: What are the two main signals sent by Slurm nodes during cancellation?
Q/A.answer: Slurm nodes send SIGCONT and SIGTERM around the same time.

Q/A.question: In the output of 'scontrol --json show job $SLURM_JOBID' for a cancelled job, what are the job_state values that can be observed?
Q/A.answer: The job_state values can be ['CANCELLED', 'COMPLETING'].

Q/A.question: What happens if processes don't stop within a certain time during a job cancellation?
Q/A.answer: Eventually, SIGKILL will be sent.

Q/A.question: What occurs when a job is preempted?
Q/A.answer: Once the job is stopped, it enters the PENDING state for two minutes before being eligible to run again.

Q/A.question: What environment variable is defined when a job runs again after being preempted or requeued?
Q/A.answer: The environment variable SLURM_RESTART_COUNT is defined, reporting the number of times the job has been preempted/requeued.

Q/A.question: What command can you run to determine the job state when handling the SIGTERM signal?
Q/A.answer: You can run 'scontrol --json show job $SLURM_JOBID' within your script.

Q/A.question: How is the output of 'scontrol --json show job $SLURM_JOBID' related to the Slurm REST API?
Q/A.answer: The output is equivalent to the Slurm REST API's endpoint 'GET /slurm/v0.0.40/job/{job_id}'.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to manually cancel a job?
Q/A.answer: You would use the command 'scancel <job id>'.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to requeue a job?
Q/A.answer: You would use the command 'scontrol requeue <job id>'.

Q/A.question: How can a job behave differently based on whether it was previously preempted?
Q/A.answer: You can check if the environment variable SLURM_RESTART_COUNT is defined.

Q/A.question: What is Tensorflow?
Q/A.answer: Tensorflow is a Python deep learning package from Google.

Q/A.question: What is the easiest way to install Tensorflow?
Q/A.answer: The easiest way to install Tensorflow is to build a Python virtualenv with it in it.

Q/A.question: What should you load first to enable accelerated GPGPU training?
Q/A.answer: You should load GPU modules to allow access to accelerated GPGPU training.

Q/A.question: Where can you find the list of Tensorflow versions and their corresponding requirements?
Q/A.answer: You can find the list of Tensorflow versions and their corresponding Python/CUDA/cuDNN requirements on the official Tensorflow installation page.

Q/A.question: As of April 29, 2024, what is the latest Tensorflow release version?
Q/A.answer: The latest Tensorflow release version as of April 29, 2024, is 2.16.1.

Q/A.question: What are the specific module commands listed for Tensorflow version 2.16.1?
Q/A.answer: The commands are: module add Python3/3.9.16 cuda/12.4.1 cudnn/v8.9.7.

Q/A.question: How do you create a virtual environment for Tensorflow?
Q/A.answer: You can create a virtual environment by using the command `$ python3 -m venv env` followed by `$ source env/bin/activate`.

Q/A.question: How do you update pip within the virtual environment?
Q/A.answer: You update pip by running the command `(env) $ pip install --upgrade pip`.

Q/A.question: What command is used to install Tensorflow in the virtual environment?
Q/A.answer: The command to install Tensorflow is `(env) $ pip install --upgrade tensorflow`.

Q/A.question: What is the command to import Tensorflow in Python after installation?
Q/A.answer: The command to import Tensorflow is `import tensorflow as tf`.

Q/A.question: What warning might you see when running Tensorflow related to TensorRT?
Q/A.answer: 'TF-TRT Warning: Could not find TensorRT'.

Q/A.question: What is the output of `tf.__version__` after importing Tensorflow?
What dataset is imported in the example code provided?
Q/A.answer: The dataset imported is the MNIST dataset.

Q/A.question: What steps are taken to preprocess the training and testing data?
Q/A.answer: The training and testing data are normalized by dividing by 255.0.

Q/A.question: What type of model is created in the example code?
Q/A.answer: A Sequential model is created.

Q/A.question: Which activation function is used in the first Dense layer of the model?
Q/A.answer: The activation function used is `tf.nn.relu`.

Q/A.question: What loss function is defined for compiling the model?
Q/A.answer: The loss function defined is 'sparse_categorical_crossentropy'.

Q/A.question: How many epochs is the model trained for?
Q/A.answer: The model is trained for 5 epochs.

Q/A.question: What must be done to use the install after closing the shell?
Q/A.answer: You must both add the correct CUDA/cuDNN modules, export the XLA_FLAGS variable (if needed), and activate the virtualenv by the source command.

Q/A.question: Which operation can cause slightly different numerical results in Tensorflow due to floating-point round-off errors?
Q/A.answer: The oneDNN custom operations can cause slightly different numerical results due to floating-point round-off errors.

Q/A.question: What is the command to export XLA_FLAGS?
Q/A.answer: The command is `export XLA_FLAGS=--xla_gpu_cuda_data_dir=/opt/common/cuda/cuda-x.x.x`.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of the Room PC in ATL 3100A?
Q/A.answer: The Room PC, also referred to as 'PC Main', is used to project video and audio sources to the displays in the room.

Q/A.question: What feature does the 'Audio Override' output device provide?
Q/A.answer: It decouples the source audio from the source video, allowing users to send audio from one source while maintaining video from a different source.

Q/A.question: How can participants hear the room audience during a teleconference?
Q/A.answer: By using both the laptop and the room PC in the same teleconference session, while setting the video source to 'Laptop' and switching the audio override to 'PC Main'.

Q/A.question: What steps must be taken to use the Room PC?

Q/A.question: What action should be taken when shutting down the ATL 3100A room?

Q/A.question: What can users expect when they choose the Solstice option?

Q/A.question: How is the Laptop connected to the room's display?

Q/A.question: What is important to note about logging off the Room PC?
Q/A.answer: The account is fully wiped upon logging off, ensuring that the next group does not have access to previous data.

Q/A.question: What type of panel is used in the conference rooms?

Q/A.question: How does the Solstice Pod functionality support device connection?
Q/A.answer: The Solstice Pod allows for wireless display connection, with specific instructions available on the room's display.

Q/A.question: What should be done when finished using the ATL 3100C room?
Q/A.answer: Touch the 'System Power' button and select 'Power Off' to turn off the display for the next group.

Q/A.question: What is Jira used for at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Jira is used as a request and bug tracker to provide HelpDesk functionality to users.

Q/A.question: How can users access Jira?
Q/A.answer: Users can access Jira through the URL https://intranet.umiacs.umd.edu/jira.

Q/A.question: What feature does Jira have that aids in ticket creation for non-UMIACS users?
Q/A.answer: When a non-UMIACS user emails Jira, a ticket is created and their email address is added as a participant.

Q/A.question: What happens the first time you use a new email address to submit a ticket in Jira?
Q/A.answer: You will receive an automated email containing a link to set a password for the newly-created Jira account.

Q/A.question: What credentials are needed to log in to Jira for UMIACS account holders?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS account holders need to log in using their UMIACS credentials through the UMIACS Single Sign On service.

Q/A.question: If you forget your password for Jira, what steps should you take?

Q/A.answer: Jira is described as a web-based ticketing system.

Q/A.question: Why is Jira beneficial for communication and issue resolution?
Q/A.answer: It allows both users and staff to maintain greater control over their tickets, making communication and resolution of issues seamless.

Q/A.question: What is the URL for the Customer Portal of Jira for UMIACS account holders?
Q/A.answer: The URL is https://intranet.umiacs.umd.edu/jira/servicedesk/customer/portal/.

Q/A.question: What will happen if a ticket is created using a non-UMIACS email address?
Q/A.answer: You will need to log in to Jira using that non-UMIACS email address to see the ticket.

Q/A.question: What action should be taken after finishing a session on the Conference user account?

Q/A.question: Where do you find the Zoom application on the desktop?

Q/A.question: What credentials are required to sign in to Zoom using SSO?

Q/A.question: What is required to join an existing Zoom meeting?

Q/A.question: What should you click to invite participants to your Zoom meeting?

Q/A.question: How can you connect audio for Zoom meetings using the lectern microphone?

Q/A.question: What do you need to do to display video from a personal laptop in Zoom?

Q/A.question: What should you do at the end of a Zoom meeting regarding the Conference account?

Q/A.question: What type of network does UMIACS provide in Iribe?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS provides a wired network in Iribe for connecting transient devices like laptops.

Q/A.question: What is the URL to check the status of your registration?
Q/A.answer: The URL to check the status of your registration is https://packetfence00.iribe.umd.edu/status.

Q/A.question: What should a user do to disconnect from the network?
Q/A.answer: A user can disconnect from the network by visiting https://packetfence00.iribe.umd.edu/networklogoff.

Q/A.question: How can one request the wired network be made available at their desk?
Q/A.answer: To request the wired network be made available at a desk, email the request to staff@umiacs.umd.edu with the label of the yellow network jack you are trying to connect.

Q/A.question: What is the most common variable in UNIX and Windows that affects command execution from the command line?
Q/A.answer: The most common variable is the PATH variable.

Q/A.question: How can you view your current PATH variable in the shell?
Q/A.answer: You can see your PATH variable by using the built-in echo command in the shell with the command '$ echo $PATH'.

Q/A.question: What are the components of a typical PATH variable output shown in the example?
Q/A.answer: /usr/kerberos/bin:/usr/local/bin:/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/X11R6/bin

Q/A.question: What is a recommended practice when modifying your PATH variable?
Q/A.answer: You will want to append to either the beginning or end of your PATH variable and not replace it fully.

Q/A.question: How do you append the path '/opt/UMtorque/bin' to the end of your PATH variable in tcsh/csh?
Q/A.answer: You would use the command 'setenv PATH ${PATH}:/opt/UMtorque/bin'.

Q/A.question: Which command would you use in bash to append a new path to the PATH variable?
Q/A.answer: In bash, you would use 'export PATH=${PATH}:/opt/UMtorque/bin'.

Q/A.question: Can modifications to the PATH variable be made temporarily, or can they also be saved for future shell sessions?
Q/A.answer: These can be either typed into your shell directly or added to your shell's initialization files so every time you spawn a shell it will get this new PATH.

Q/A.question: What is the step to modify the Windows PATH Environmental Variable according to the wiki page?
Q/A.answer: Go to Control Panel and click on User Accounts, then click on the User Accounts heading within User Accounts.

Q/A.question: In Windows, what should you do if the PATH variable does not exist in User Variables?
Q/A.answer: If there is none, click New and put PATH for the Variable name.

Q/A.question: After modifying the Windows PATH variable, how can you verify that the changes are correct?
Q/A.answer: Open a new Command Prompt and type in 'PATH'. The updated PATH should be printed.

Q/A.question: What has UMIACS staff deployed to combat security vulnerabilities on Windows machines?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS staff has deployed Ivanti Security and Compliance Manager.

Q/A.question: What type of applications are currently the focus of updates?
Q/A.answer: The updates are focused on applications that are exposed to the internet, such as web browsers, teleconferencing solutions, Adobe Flash, and Java.

Q/A.question: On which devices is Ivanti currently deployed?
Q/A.answer: Ivanti is deployed on all UMIACS-supported Windows desktops as well as Enterprise supported Windows laptops and home machines.

Q/A.question: When are patches deployed relative to the maintenance window?
Q/A.answer: Patches are deployed during the week leading up to the maintenance window, specifically released on the Wednesday that falls between the 9th and the 15th of every month, typically in the morning.

Q/A.question: How often do desktops scan for updates?
Q/A.answer: Desktops scan for updates to be installed every night sometime between 7pm and 9pm.

Q/A.question: What happens if you are not logged in during the scanning times?
Q/A.answer: If you are not logged in during those times, the system will automatically install the patches and reboot if necessary.

Q/A.question: How frequently do laptops scan for updates, assuming they are powered on?
Q/A.answer: Laptops will scan for updates to be installed at least once every day.

Q/A.question: What is required for a laptop to scan for updates?
Q/A.answer: The laptop must have an active Internet connection, either wired or wireless.

Q/A.question: How long can update installation be deferred on desktops and laptops?
Q/A.answer: Installation can be deferred for 24 hours on desktops and 3 hours on laptops.

Q/A.question: What is recommended if a reboot is required after installation finishes?
Q/A.answer: It is highly suggested to reboot right away due to system instability and vulnerability, although the reboot can be deferred for up to 6 days if desired.

Q/A.question: What happens if you do not respond to the reboot prompt in time?
Q/A.answer: If you do not respond to the prompt within a given amount of time, the machine will automatically reboot: 24 hours for desktops and 9 hours for laptops.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you interrupt the installation process?
Q/A.answer: If you interrupt the installation process, Ivanti may ask to reboot before continuing to install the remaining patches the next time it pops up.

Q/A.question: When should manual scanning be done?
Q/A.answer: Manual scanning should only be done on laptops or home machines if Ivanti has not had a large enough time window to scan your computer recently, or optionally if you see fit.

Q/A.question: What do you need to do to perform a manual scan?
Q/A.answer: You need to search for 'Security Scan' from the Start menu and click the result that shows up.

Q/A.question: What could cause the scan to fail at the 'Checking for other running scanners' step?
Q/A.answer: The scan may fail if Ivanti is already running an invisible scan in the background.

Q/A.question: What should you do if all patches have been downloaded after a manual scan?
Q/A.answer: You will be prompted to allow the install to begin.

Q/A.question: What can you set if you do not want to reboot immediately after installation?
Q/A.answer: You can click on the 'Remind me in:' drop down menu, click 'More options...', select 'Remind me on' radio button, and choose a date and time before the deadline.

Q/A.question: How can you verify that no patches are detected after reboot?
Q/A.answer: After reboot, run another scan to verify no patches are detected.

Q/A.question: What should you do if a patch is continually failing?
Q/A.answer: Contact staff if a patch is continually failing.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the intranet page mentioned in the announcements section?
Q/A.answer: The intranet page is used for accessing announcements related to UMIACS.

Q/A.question: List three core services offered by UMIACS.
Q/A.answer: The three core services offered by UMIACS include Email, Data Storage, and Backups.

Q/A.question: What information can you find in the 'Ordering Equipment' section?
Q/A.answer: The 'Ordering Equipment' section provides information on ordering equipment requests and best practices.

Q/A.question: Which policy is linked in the General Information section?
Q/A.answer: The University of Maryland Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) is linked in the General Information section.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended course of action for editing content on the wiki?
Q/A.answer: Editing privileges are restricted to members of UMIACS Technical Staff, so one should contact the staff if editing is needed.

Q/A.question: Explain the purpose of the 'Publishing Data' section.
Q/A.answer: The 'Publishing Data' section outlines best practices when publishing data at UMIACS.

Q/A.question: Where can you find support information for UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Support information for UMIACS can be found in the 'Getting help (UMIACS Help Desk)' section.

Q/A.question: What does the term 'Web Accessibility' in the General Information section imply?
Q/A.answer: Web Accessibility refers to ensuring that the web content is accessible to all users, including those with disabilities.

Q/A.question: Why is login access to the wiki restricted?
Q/A.answer: Login access to the wiki is restricted to maintain the integrity and security of the content, allowing only UMIACS Technical Staff to edit.

Q/A.question: What can be inferred about UMIACS's approach to data handling?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS emphasizes best practices for data handling and provides resources like the 'Publishing Data' section to guide users.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the guide provided in the 'Introduction' section?
Q/A.answer: The guide helps users install and use the printers available within UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What must users do if they are off the UMIACS network and want to print?
Q/A.answer: Users must first connect to the VPN on Windows before adding a printer queue.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of the prefix 'UMIACS\' when adding a printer queue?
Q/A.answer: It is required to prefix 'UMIACS\' to your username when authentication is needed if you are not signed into Windows with your UMIACS account.

Q/A.question: Describe the steps to add a printer queue on UMIACS network.
Q/A.answer: Go to Start, search '\printers.ad.umiacs.umd.edu', authenticate with 'UMIACS\username', check 'Remember my credentials', select printer from the list, and wait for the driver installation.

Q/A.question: What potential issue might arise related to printer security when adding a printer queue, and how can it be resolved?
Q/A.answer: If a user receives an error due to higher printer security because of the PrintNightmare vulnerability, they can resolve it by running specific commands in the Command Prompt as an administrator.

Q/A.question: How do you remove a printer queue in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Open the Start menu, search for Control Panel, click on 'View devices and printers', right-click on the printer, and select 'Remove device'.

Q/A.question: What are the steps to set duplex printing as default on UMIACS printers?
Q/A.answer: Right-click on the installed printer queue, select 'Printing preferences', go to the 'Printing Shortcuts' tab, choose 'EcoSMART Settings', and click OK.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of PIN-protected jobs when printing at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: PIN-protected jobs ensure that print jobs are not printed until the user is ready to pick them up, which is useful for sensitive documents.

Q/A.question: Outline the process to create a stored job for PIN printing.
Q/A.answer: From the software program, select Print, choose the printer, select Properties or Preferences, go to Job Storage tab, select 'Personal Job', choose 'PIN to print', enter a 4-digit PIN, and click OK.

Q/A.question: After a job is printed using a PIN, what happens to the job in memory?
Q/A.answer: The print job is deleted from memory after it prints.

Q/A.question: Which networks should be avoided when trying to add a printer queue at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Wireless networks alone such as eduroam and umd-guest should be avoided, as they do not allow adding a printer queue.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of SLURM?
Q/A.answer: SLURM offers a variety of ways to run jobs, and it is important to understand the different options available and how to request the resources required for a job to run successfully.

Q/A.question: From which nodes should job submission be conducted?
Q/A.answer: All job submission should be done from submit nodes.

Q/A.question: What happens to computationally intensive processes run on submission nodes?
Q/A.answer: They will be terminated; jobs should be submitted to compute nodes.

Q/A.question: What command is used to run a process on compute nodes?
Q/A.answer: The command used is 'srun'.

Q/A.question: What does the command 'srun --qos=default --mem=100mb --time=1:00:00 bash -c 'echo "Hello World from" `hostname`'' accomplish?
Q/A.answer: It runs a shell command that outputs 'Hello World from' followed by the hostname of the compute node.

Q/A.question: In the context of SLURM, what does the '--mem' flag specify when used with srun?
Q/A.answer: '--mem' requests a certain amount of memory for the job.

Q/A.question: How can one run an interactive shell session on a compute node using SLURM?
Q/A.answer: An interactive shell can be acquired by using 'srun' with the '--pty' argument.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to request the allocation of resources without needing a batch script?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'salloc'.

Q/A.question: What is the difference between 'salloc' and 'sbatch'?
Q/A.answer: 'salloc' allocates resources for an interactive session, while 'sbatch' is used to submit a batch script for non-interactive execution.

Q/A.question: What is the role of the 'sbatch' command?
Q/A.answer: The 'sbatch' command allows users to submit a batch script to be run non-interactively on the compute nodes.

Q/A.question: Which command is used to cancel job allocations?
Q/A.answer: The command 'scancel' is used for canceling job allocations or job steps.

Q/A.question: What does the 'sinfo' command do?
Q/A.answer: The 'sinfo' command shows additional features of nodes in the cluster.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the 'show_nodes' command alias?
Q/A.answer: 'show_nodes' shows each node's name, number of CPUs, memory, OS, CPU architecture, CPU type, GPU architecture, and state.

Q/A.question: What does 'show_available_nodes' command alias do?
Q/A.answer: 'show_available_nodes' shows what nodes could theoretically run a job with specified arguments.

Q/A.question: How do you request access to GPUs when submitting a job in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: You can request GPUs using the flag '--gres=gpu:#', with the actual number of GPUs you want.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you need a specific type of GPU for your job?
Q/A.answer: You should specify it using the flag '--gres=gpu:Type:#', where 'Type' is the specific GPU type required.

Q/A.question: What does MPI stand for, and how is it relevant in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: MPI stands for Message Passing Interface, and it is relevant as users can run MPI jobs in SLURM by including the '--mpi=pmix' flag in their submission arguments.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of the UMIACS page about Network/VPN/MFA?
Q/A.answer: The page outlines the steps required to enable Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) for the Pulse Secure VPN.

Q/A.question: When did the MFA requirement become mandatory?
Q/A.answer: The MFA requirement became mandatory on May 10th, 2019.

Q/A.question: What is the first credential required for authentication in the Pulse Secure VPN?
Q/A.answer: The first credential required is the UMIACS password.

Q/A.question: What options are available for the second credential in MFA?
Q/A.answer: The second credential can be either a push notification to a Duo connected device or a phone call to a Duo connected device, or pressing a YubiKey if one is available.

Q/A.question: What must you do if you want to use a YubiKey for the Pulse VPN?
Q/A.answer: You need to contact UMIACS Tech Staff to program the YubiKey for you.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended action after entering the secondary password option in the Duo prompt?
Q/A.answer: It is recommended to select 'Save Settings' to automatically use your preferred method for future authentications.

Q/A.question: Describe the process for connecting with the Pulse VPN using push authentication.
Q/A.answer: Connect with your existing Pulse VPN profile, enter your UMIACS credentials for the first authentication box and tick 'Save settings', then type 'push' into the password field on the second authentication box, tick 'Save settings', and click Connect to receive a push to your mobile device.

Q/A.question: Is it possible to register other hardware tokens for use with the Pulse VPN?
Q/A.answer: No, UMIACS only supports registering YubiKey tokens for this purpose.

Q/A.question: What happens after you connect to the VPN using the push method?
Q/A.answer: You will receive a push notification to your mobile device to complete authentication every time you connect to the VPN going forward.

Q/A.question: Why is it important to configure MFA for the Pulse VPN?
Q/A.answer: Configuring MFA is important for enhancing security by requiring an additional authentication factor beyond just a password.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the '#!/bin/bash' line in the script?
Q/A.answer: This line indicates that the script should be run in the Bash shell, specifying the interpreter for the script.

Q/A.question: What are the resource specifications indicated by the '#PBS' lines in the script?
Q/A.answer: The '#PBS -lwalltime=0:10:0' line specifies a wall time limit of 10 minutes, and the '#PBS -lnodes=8' line requests 8 nodes for the job.

Q/A.question: How does the script set up the environment for the program it runs?
Q/A.answer: The script sets up the path by exporting a new PATH variable that includes '/usr/local/stow/lam-7.1.4/bin' appended to the existing PATH.

Q/A.question: What command is executed to run the MPI program in the script?
Q/A.answer: The command executed is '/usr/local/stow/lam-7.1.4/bin/mpiexec -machinefile ${PBS_NODEFILE} /nfshomes/xhe/torquejobs/lamtest/alltoall-lam'.

Q/A.question: What does the 'echo starting' line do in the context of the script?
Q/A.answer: The 'echo starting' line outputs the text 'starting' to the terminal, indicating that the execution of the script is beginning.

Q/A.question: What output does the script generate at the end based on its content?
Q/A.answer: At the end of the script, the command 'echo ending' will output the text 'ending' to the terminal, indicating the program's completion.

Q/A.question: Explain the use of the variable '${PBS_NODEFILE}' in the mpiexec command.
Q/A.answer: The variable '${PBS_NODEFILE}' is used to specify the file that contains a list of nodes allocated for the job, which is necessary for running distributed programs with MPI.

Q/A.question: What might be the significance of the command '$PATHecho' if it were correctly formatted?
Q/A.answer: If correctly formatted, '$PATHecho' would likely output the current PATH variable; however, the way it is written is incorrect as there should be a space or semicolon separating commands.

Q/A.question: What are the four locations mentioned for public printers in the Iribe Center?
Q/A.answer: The four locations for public printers are rooms 3208, 4149, 4208, and 5208.

Q/A.question: What types of printers are available in room 3208?
Q/A.answer: Room 3208 has a color printer (cps432-3208) which is an HP Color LaserJet Enterprise M653 and a black/white printer (ps432-3208) which is an HP LaserJet Enterprise Flow MFP M633.

Q/A.question: Which printer in room 4208 also has faxing capabilities?
Q/A.answer: The black/white printer ps432-4208 in room 4208 has faxing capability.

Q/A.question: How can one print if they do not have access to printers in their lab?
Q/A.answer: One can access public printers located in multiple floors in the Iribe Center.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you are unsure how to connect to the public printers?
Q/A.answer: You should see the other articles on printing in UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What is the printer model for the color printer in room 4149?
Q/A.answer: The color printer in room 4149 is an HP Color LaserJet Enterprise M653.

Q/A.question: List the printer types found in room 5208.
Q/A.answer: Room 5208 has a color printer (cps432-5208) which is an HP Color LaserJet Enterprise M653 and a black/white printer (ps432-5208) which is an HP LaserJet Enterprise Flow MFP M633.

Q/A.question: What additional resources does UMIACS provide for printing?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS provides guides such as Selecting A Print Queue (Color/Driver), UNIX Printing Guide (Linux and Solaris), Windows Printing Guide, macOS Printing Guide, and Printing Double Sided From a USB.

Q/A.question: What automounter is utilized in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The automounter utilized in UMIACS is autofs.

Q/A.question: Which file system is almost always mounted with the automounter at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Almost all file systems are mounted with NFS.

Q/A.question: How can you utilize the automounter in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: You can utilize the automounter by just changing the directory into the target or into a directory underneath the target.

Q/A.question: What is the most common file system mounted with the automounter at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The most common file system mounted this way is /nfshomes/fs/nexus-scratch.

Q/A.question: What happens when you change the directory into the target of the automounter?
Q/A.answer: Changing the directory into the target will allow you to utilize the automounter.

Q/A.question: What are the implications of using the automounter for file system management?
Q/A.answer: The automounter simplifies the process of accessing file systems by automatically mounting them when a user changes into the specified directory.

Q/A.question: Can you provide a detailed account of the NFS's role in file systems mounted by the automounter?
Q/A.answer: NFS (Network File System) serves as the primary protocol for mounting file systems with the automounter, enabling access to remote file systems as if they were local.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the monthly maintenance window conducted by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The purpose of the monthly maintenance window is to patch and reboot all UMIACS-supported hosts and services to ensure that security updates are installed and activated.

Q/A.question: How is the date for the monthly maintenance window determined?
Q/A.answer: The date for the monthly maintenance window is calculated by adding 9 days to Microsoft's Patch Tuesday.

Q/A.question: On which day of the month does the maintenance window typically occur?
Q/A.answer: The maintenance window typically occurs on a Thursday that falls between the 17th and the 23rd (inclusive) of each month.

Q/A.question: What are the scheduled hours for the maintenance window?
Q/A.answer: The maintenance window lasts from 5pm to 8pm.

Q/A.question: What reservation does Nexus have during the maintenance window?
Q/A.answer: Nexus has a reservation from 4:45pm to 8pm on the day of the upcoming window to prevent jobs from being scheduled on compute nodes.

Q/A.question: What happens to jobs submitted before the reservation that might overlap with it?
Q/A.answer: Any job submitted before the reservation that has a time limit running into the reservation will be held until at least the end of the reservation at 8pm.

Q/A.question: List the next three upcoming maintenance windows mentioned in the text.
Q/A.answer: The next three upcoming maintenance windows are October 17th, 2024; November 21st, 2024; and December 19th, 2024.

Q/A.question: What was different about the maintenance window on January 17th, 2013?
Q/A.answer: The maintenance window on January 17th, 2013, had a different time span of 8pm to 12am.

Q/A.question: How was the date of March 12th, 2016 adjusted?
Q/A.answer: The date of March 12th, 2016, was adjusted for an AVW power outage.

Q/A.question: What time did the maintenance window change to beginning on September 23rd, 2021?
Q/A.answer: The maintenance window changed to a time of 5-8pm beginning on September 23rd, 2021.

Q/A.question: How many maintenance windows are listed between January 2013 and December 2024?
Q/A.answer: There are 84 maintenance windows listed between January 2013 and December 2024.

Q/A.question: What was the end time for the maintenance windows from April 23rd, 2020, to August 19th, 2021?
Q/A.answer: The end time for the maintenance windows during that period was 7pm.

Q/A.question: What should be avoided regarding jobs during the maintenance window?
Q/A.answer: Jobs should be prevented from failing to end properly, as this can cause delays in work scheduled during the maintenance window.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of SLURM?
Q/A.answer: SLURM is an open-source workload manager designed for Linux clusters, providing functions such as resource allocation, job execution and monitoring, and managing resource contention.

Q/A.question: List three key functions of SLURM.
Q/A.answer: 1. Allocating resources (computer nodes) to users for a duration of time. 2. Providing a framework for starting, executing, and monitoring work on allocated nodes. 3. Managing a queue of pending work to arbitrate contention for resources.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to run a parallel job on SLURM?
Q/A.answer: The command to run a parallel job on SLURM is 'srun'.

Q/A.question: What is the function of the command 'salloc'?
Q/A.answer: 'salloc' allocates a SLURM job allocation, which is a set of resources, and can run a specified command after obtaining the allocation.

Q/A.question: How does 'sbatch' differ from 'salloc'?
Q/A.answer: 'sbatch' is used to submit a batch script to SLURM, while 'salloc' is used to allocate resources interactively and run a command within that allocation.

Q/A.question: Describe what the 'squeue' command does.
Q/A.answer: 'squeue' views job and job step information for jobs that are being managed by SLURM.

Q/A.question: What type of information can 'sacct' provide?
Q/A.answer: 'sacct' displays job accounting data in various forms, including information on jobs, job steps, status, and exit codes.

Q/A.question: Explain how to run a Jupyter Notebook on a compute node using SLURM.
Q/A.answer: After creating and activating a Python virtual environment and installing Jupyter, you submit a job to SLURM, activate the environment within the job, and run 'jupyter notebook --no-browser --port=8889 --ip=0.0.0.0'.

Q/A.question: What SSH command is required to access the Jupyter notebook from your local machine?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'ssh -N -f -L localhost:8888:<NODENAME>:8889 <USERNAME>@<SUBMISSIONNODE>.umiacs.umd.edu'.

Q/A.question: What do you need to prepend to the URL provided by the terminal output of Jupyter if token authentication is enabled?
Q/A.answer: You need to prepend '/?token=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX' to the URL.

Q/A.question: What was the previous workload manager used at UMIACS before SLURM?
Q/A.answer: PBS/TORQUE was the previous workload manager used at UMIACS prior to SLURM's adoption.

Q/A.question: What is the syntax for job submission in SLURM as compared to PBS/TORQUE?
Q/A.answer: In PBS/TORQUE, the command is 'qsub [filename]', while in SLURM, it is 'sbatch [filename]'.

Q/A.question: How would you cancel a job in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: You would use the command 'scancel [job_id]'.

Q/A.question: What directive is used to specify a job name in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: The directive to specify a job name in SLURM is '--job-name=[name]' or '-J [name]'.

Q/A.question: What is one potential issue you might face when trying to run a Jupyter notebook on a specific port?
Q/A.answer: If the port on the compute node is already in use by another process, you may not be able to start the Jupyter notebook on that port.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of Kerberos according to the introduction?
Q/A.answer: The primary purpose of Kerberos is to provide a toolkit for reducing the risks associated with insecure networks.

Q/A.question: What does Kerberos offer regarding password management?
Q/A.answer: Kerberos provides a unified password space in which users can manage strong passwords easily.

Q/A.question: What happens to credentials after one week at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Credentials expire after one week at UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to examine current credentials?
Q/A.answer: The command 'klist' can be used to examine current credentials.

Q/A.question: What indicates that you are authenticated to the realm 'AD.UMIACS.UMD.EDU'?
Q/A.answer: The Kerberos principal 'username@AD.UMIACS.UMD.EDU' indicates that you are authenticated as the user 'username' to the realm 'AD.UMIACS.UMD.EDU'.

Q/A.question: What can cause your user environment to behave erratically?
Q/A.answer: The lack of credentials can cause the user environment to behave erratically as network resources become unavailable.

Q/A.question: How does Kerberos enhance the security of IMAP and SMTP services?
Q/A.answer: Kerberos authenticated IMAP and SMTP provide secure methods for sending and reading mail, ensuring that your password is never sent over the network as cleartext.

Q/A.question: What should you do nightly according to the best practices suggested in the document?
Q/A.answer: Users are strongly suggested to log out of their environments nightly.

Q/A.question: What does 'Default principal' signify in the output of the 'klist' command?
Q/A.answer: 'Default principal' indicates the Kerberos identity of the current process.

Q/A.question: Why is securing your password vital in the context of Kerberos?
Q/A.answer: Kerberos security depends on the security of your password, as it can make secure access to services convenient.

Q/A.question: What would klist report if credentials have not been set up correctly?
Q/A.answer: If credentials have not been set up correctly, klist will report 'klist: No credentials cache found'.

Q/A.question: What time does the ticket expire in the 'klist' output example provided?
Q/A.answer: The ticket expires at 05/28/18 18:19:36.

Q/A.answer: The Maintenance reports section includes broken redirects, dead-end pages, double redirects, long pages, oldest pages, orphaned pages, pages with the fewest revisions, pages without language links, protected pages, protected titles, short pages, uncategorized categories, uncategorized files, uncategorized pages, uncategorized templates, unused categories, unused files, unused templates, wanted categories, wanted files, wanted pages, and wanted templates.

Q/A.question: What can be found under the section titled 'Lists of pages'?
Q/A.answer: Under the 'Lists of pages' section, you can find all pages, all pages with a prefix, categories, external links, a list of redirects, pages with a page property, and a search for tracking categories.

Q/A.question: Which rights-related information is provided under the 'Users and rights' section?
Q/A.answer: The 'Users and rights' section includes an active users list, autoblocks, blocked users, bot passwords, grants, link accounts, password policies, preferences, reset tokens, unlink accounts, user contributions, user group rights, user list, and user rights.

Q/A.question: Describe what is covered by the section titled 'Recent changes and logs'.
Q/A.answer: The 'Recent changes and logs' section covers the gallery of new files, logs, new pages, recent changes, related changes, valid change tags, and a watchlist.

Q/A.question: What types of resources are detailed in the 'Media reports and uploads' section?
Q/A.answer: The 'Media reports and uploads' section details a file list, lists of files with duplicates, MIME search, and media statistics, as well as a search for duplicate files.

Q/A.question: What functionalities are offered for managing pages in the 'Redirecting special pages' section?
Q/A.answer: The 'Redirecting special pages' section offers functionalities like delete a page, view differences, edit a page, add a new section, view page history, access page info, create a permanent link, protect a page, purge, random page, random page in category, random redirect, and redirect by file, user, page, revision, or log ID.

Q/A.question: Which pages are included in the 'High use pages' section?
Q/A.answer: The 'High use pages' section includes most linked-to categories, most linked-to files, most linked-to pages, most transcluded pages, pages with the most categories, pages with the most interwikis, and pages with the most revisions.

Q/A.question: What tools are available under the 'Page tools' section?
Q/A.answer: The 'Page tools' section includes compare pages, export pages, and what links here.

Q/A.question: What is the initial step to view room schedules through Google Calendar?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to https://calendar.google.com and ensure that you are logged into your UMD account.

Q/A.question: What type of accounts can view the rooms?
Q/A.answer: Only UMD accounts can view rooms.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you are not logged into your UMD account?
Q/A.answer: You should switch or add an account, and Google has instructions for this.

Q/A.question: How do you log into your UMD account if you don't have a current session open?
Q/A.answer: You will be redirected to the UMD Central Authentication System (CAS) login page after entering your UMD username appended with @umd.edu.

Q/A.question: Where can you find the settings menu in Google Calendar?
Q/A.answer: Click on the cog in the top right to open the settings menu.

Q/A.question: What specific resources do you need to browse to add rooms to your Google Calendar?

Q/A.question: What building code is associated with Iribe when browsing room resources?
Q/A.answer: The building code for Iribe is IRB.

Q/A.question: What action should you take to add a room to your calendar view?
Q/A.answer: Tick the checkbox for each room that you want to add to your Google Calendar view.

Q/A.question: How can you return to the main Google Calendar view after adding rooms?

Q/A.question: What options do you have to manage subscribed calendars in Google Calendar?

Q/A.question: What is Solstice?
Q/A.answer: Solstice is a wireless content sharing solution that enables multiple users to connect simultaneously to a shared display using laptops and mobile devices over an existing wireless network.

Q/A.question: Which conference rooms are equipped with Solstice Mersive Pods?
Q/A.answer: All conference rooms in the Brendan Iribe Center and some in the Atlantic Building are equipped with Solstice Mersive Pods.

Q/A.question: What is displayed on the Welcome Screen when no collaboration session is active?
Q/A.answer: The Welcome Screen contains the Solstice display name, a screen key, network information, user connection instructions, and the Solstice display menu.

Q/A.question: How do you connect to a Solstice display using the Solstice User App?
Q/A.answer: To connect to a Solstice display, ensure you are connected to either the UMD wireless or wired network, open the Solstice user app, search for a specific display by name/IP, enter the screen key when prompted, and then the user app will join the collaboration session.

Q/A.question: What is the minimum iOS version supported for full mirroring using AirPlay?
Q/A.answer: Solstice supports full mirroring of iOS devices running iOS 7 or later.

Q/A.question: Describe the steps to mirror an iOS device screen using AirPlay.
Q/A.answer: Ensure the iOS device is connected to the correct WiFi network, open the iOS Control Center, tap the Screen Mirroring button, select the desired Solstice display from the list, enter the screen key if prompted, and your device will connect wirelessly to the display.

Q/A.question: What should you do if the desired Solstice display does not appear in the AirPlay menu?
Q/A.answer: Open the Solstice App and connect to the desired display, then repeat the steps to mirror your screen.

Q/A.question: What keyboard shortcut is used on a Windows device to connect to a wireless display?
Q/A.answer: On a Windows laptop, you use the keyboard shortcut Windows key + P.

Q/A.question: What should you do if the Solstice display is enabled for Miracast but not visible in the list of available displays?
Q/A.answer: You should try scrolling down in the list to ensure it is not hidden.

Q/A.question: How can you stop Miracast streaming to the display?
Q/A.answer: To stop Miracast streaming, hit the Windows key + P, click Connect to a wireless display, and then click Disconnect.

Q/A.question: What does Mersive recommend using as the display option when streaming with Miracast?
Q/A.answer: Mersive recommends using the Duplicate setting when streaming with Miracast.

Q/A.question: What is the first step recommended for fixing a stuck electric adjustable standing desk?
Q/A.answer: Disconnect the table from the outlet/power source.

Q/A.question: Where is the power box located for the standing desk to disconnect the controller cable?
Q/A.answer: Either underneath the desktop or to the desk frame.

Q/A.question: What color is the end of the controller cable that needs to be disconnected?
Q/A.answer: Blue.

Q/A.question: Which connector should the cable from the table leg on the same side as the up/down controls be connected to?
Q/A.answer: M1 connector.

Q/A.question: What must be done before connecting to the M2 connector?
Q/A.answer: You must connect a cable to the M1 connector.

Q/A.question: If the desk moves in the opposite direction or only moves a short distance, what is the suggested action?
Q/A.answer: Repeat the steps listed above but switch which legs go to the M1 and M2 connectors.

Q/A.question: What must be pressed and held for 5 seconds after reconnecting the table to the power source?
Q/A.answer: The down button.

Q/A.question: What should be felt after holding the down button for 5 seconds?
Q/A.answer: A very slight movement.

Q/A.question: What happens if the steps are not correctly followed when connecting the table leg cables?
Q/A.answer: The desk may move in the opposite direction of the button pressed or only move a short distance before stopping and becoming stuck again.

Q/A.question: What is Gurobi Optimizer?
Q/A.answer: Gurobi Optimizer is a suite of solvers for mathematical programming.

Q/A.question: How can Gurobi Optimizer be accessed?
Q/A.answer: Gurobi can be accessed through the module tree with the command module add gurobi.

Q/A.question: Where can more information about Gurobi be found?
Q/A.answer: More information can be found on the Modules page and the documentation at https://www.gurobi.com/documentation/.

Q/A.question: What error occurs when trying to use Gurobi on Nexus submission nodes?
Q/A.answer: The error message 'Error 10009: Server must be on the same subnet' occurs when trying to use Gurobi on Nexus submission nodes.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you encounter Error 10009 while using Gurobi?
Q/A.answer: If you encounter Error 10009, you should try running the command in a SLURM job.

Q/A.question: What should you do if issues persist while using Gurobi after trying the suggested solutions?
Q/A.answer: If issues persist, you should contact the HelpDesk.

Q/A.question: What is the primary function of the setgid bit for files?
Q/A.answer: The setgid bit for files forces the file to execute with the group ID (GID) of the binary rather than that of the user running it.

Q/A.question: How does the setgid bit affect executable files?
Q/A.answer: The setgid bit only affects executable files; it has no effect on files that are not executable.

Q/A.question: What security issues can arise from using setgid for files?
Q/A.answer: Using setgid for files can lead to security issues when the group has files that may be read or written, which would not typically be permitted.

Q/A.question: What is the behavior of setgid directories?
Q/A.answer: Setgid directories inherit the group from the directory for all filesystem creations underneath that directory.

Q/A.question: What is UMIACS's policy regarding users' default UID and GID?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS policy is to keep users' default UID and GID.

Q/A.question: What happens to files created under a setgid directory?
Q/A.answer: Files created under a setgid directory have the same GID as the directory and will inherit the setgid bit.

Q/A.question: What is a recommended umask setting for effectively using setgid?
Q/A.answer: A recommended umask setting for effectively using setgid is either 002 or 007, depending on whether you want others to read/execute the files.

Q/A.question: What example command can be used to change the group of a directory called 'staff' to 'umadmin'?
Q/A.answer: 'chgrp umadmin .' is the command used to change the group of the 'staff' directory to 'umadmin'.

Q/A.question: What are the permissions set on the 'staff' directory after providing the setgid bit?
Q/A.answer: The permissions set on the 'staff' directory after applying the setgid bit are 'drwxrwsr-x'.

Q/A.question: What command can be used to set the setgid bit on a directory?
Q/A.answer: 'chmod g+s .' is the command used to set the setgid bit on a directory.

Q/A.question: Why might a user choose a umask of 002 when creating files in a setgid directory?
Q/A.answer: A user might choose a umask of 002 to allow others to read the files created in the setgid directory.

Q/A.question: How can you confirm the correct groups and permissions being used in the 'staff' directory?
Q/A.answer: You can confirm the correct groups and permissions by executing the command 'ls -la' in the 'staff' directory.

Q/A.question: What does UMIACS provide in relation to High Performance Computational (HPC) clusters?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS provides integration and maintenance of High Performance Computational (HPC) clusters.

Q/A.question: On what operating system are the HPC systems at UMIACS currently built?
Q/A.answer: The HPC systems at UMIACS are currently built on top of RHEL 7.

Q/A.question: What scheduler is used with the HPC systems at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The scheduler used with the HPC systems at UMIACS is SLURM.

Q/A.question: Are the individual configurations and schedulers of HPC systems at UMIACS standardized across all groups?
Q/A.answer: No, the individual configuration and scheduler are suited to the needs of each individual group.

Q/A.question: What can be inferred about the flexibility of HPC systems at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The HPC systems at UMIACS are flexible as they are configured according to the specific needs of each group.

Q/A.question: What is the Tron partition?
Q/A.answer: The Tron partition is a subset of resources available in the Nexus.

Q/A.question: Who purchased the resources for the Tron partition?
Q/A.answer: The resources were purchased using college-level funding for UMIACS and CSD faculty.

Q/A.question: How many nodes are included in the full configuration of the Tron partition?
Q/A.answer: The full configuration includes 70 nodes.

Q/A.question: What types of GPU nodes are included in the Tron partition, and how many of each type?
Q/A.answer: The types of GPU nodes in the Tron partition include: 6 A6000 GPU Nodes, 39 A4000 GPU Nodes, 16 A5000 GPU Nodes, and 8 RTX 2080 Ti GPU Nodes.

Q/A.question: How much memory does each A6000 GPU Node have?
Q/A.answer: Each A6000 GPU Node has 256GB of memory.

Q/A.question: How many GPU cores does each RTX 2080 Ti GPU Node have?
Q/A.answer: Each RTX 2080 Ti GPU Node has 8 GPU cores.

Q/A.question: What is the total number of CPU cores across all nodes in the Tron partition?
Q/A.answer: The total number of CPU cores across all nodes is 1,840.

Q/A.question: What is the total amount of memory available in the Tron partition?
Q/A.answer: The total amount of memory available in the Tron partition is 32,282GB.

Q/A.question: List the GPU specifications for the A4000 GPU Nodes.
Q/A.answer: The A4000 GPU Nodes have 4 GPUs per node and 128GB of memory per node.

Q/A.question: What distinguishes the A5000 GPU Nodes from the A6000 GPU Nodes in terms of memory?
Q/A.answer: The A5000 GPU Nodes have 256GB of memory, which is the same as the A6000 GPU Nodes.

Q/A.question: What should you enter in the address bar of Chrome/Chromium to manage Java plugins?
Q/A.answer: You should enter about:plugins in the address bar.

Q/A.question: How do you disable the Java plugin in Firefox?
Q/A.answer: Enter about:addons in the address bar, click the Plugins tab on the left, find the Java plugin, and click the Disable button on the right hand side.

Q/A.question: In Safari, which menu option allows you to disable Java?
Q/A.answer: You can disable Java in the Safari > Preferences menu under the Security tab by unchecking the Enable Java checkbox.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to disable Java in Internet Explorer?
Q/A.answer: Enter the Tools Menu (Gear icon in the upper right corner) and select Internet Options.

Q/A.question: What should you look for in the Security Settings box in Internet Explorer to disable Java applets?

Q/A.answer: You must uncheck the Enable Java checkbox.

Q/A.answer: You can manage the Java plugin settings, including disabling it.

Q/A.answer: In Internet Explorer, you click the Security tab.

Q/A.answer: You find it on the right hand side, next to the Java plugin.

Q/A.question: How do you start changing display settings on a Mac?
Q/A.answer: You start by opening System Preferences from the Dock or Applications folder.

Q/A.question: What option should you select to access display settings?
Q/A.answer: Once you have opened System Preferences, click on Displays.

Q/A.question: What tab must you go to in order to manage display arrangements?
Q/A.answer: You need to go to the Arrangement tab.

Q/A.question: What is the default mode for displays on MacOS?
Q/A.answer: The displays are used in extended mode by default.

Q/A.question: What do you need to do to switch from extended mode to mirror mode?
Q/A.answer: To switch to mirror mode, you must select the mirror checkbox.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of the Arrangement tab in Displays?
Q/A.answer: The Arrangement tab allows users to manage how their displays are configured relative to each other.

Q/A.question: If the displays are in extended mode, what does that imply about the use of the monitors?
Q/A.answer: Extended mode implies that the monitors are used as separate displays, allowing for more screen real estate.

Q/A.question: What would occur if you selected the mirror checkbox?
Q/A.answer: Selecting the mirror checkbox would change the display mode to mirror mode, where both displays show the same content.

Q/A.question: In what context would a user want to switch to mirror mode?
Q/A.answer: A user might want to switch to mirror mode when they need to present or share their screen with others.

Q/A.question: What is the function of System Preferences in MacOS?
Q/A.answer: System Preferences allows users to change settings for various aspects of their system, including display settings.

Q/A.question: What is the availability status of Mathematica for University-owned machines?
Q/A.answer: Mathematica is freely available to all University-owned machines.

Q/A.question: How can users access Mathematica on UMIACS-supported Linux hosts?
Q/A.answer: Users can access Mathematica through Modules by using the command 'module add mathematica'.

Q/A.question: What command should be used to check the available versions of Mathematica?
Q/A.answer: The command to check the available versions is 'module avail mathematica'.

Q/A.question: If a user wants to add a specific version of Mathematica, what command should they use?
Q/A.answer: Users should use the command 'module add mathematica/12.0' to add a specific version, such as Mathematica 12.0.

Q/A.question: Where can additional information about Modules be found?
Q/A.answer: Additional information can be found on the Modules page.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they need access on UMIACS-supported Windows machines?
Q/A.answer: Users should contact staff for assistance with UMIACS-supported Windows machines or other self-supported University-owned equipment.

Q/A.question: Is there an automated way to activate Mathematica across UMIACS's domain?
Q/A.answer: No, there is no automated way to activate Mathematica across the domain.

Q/A.question: What is required to activate Mathematica on a computer?
Q/A.answer: Each computer must be registered once against the hosted license server.

Q/A.question: What steps should be taken to activate Mathematica once prompted?
Q/A.answer: Click 'Other ways to activate', then 'Connect to a network license server', enter 'licserv.umiacs.umd.edu' as the license server, click 'Activate', accept the terms, and click ok.

Q/A.question: What condition must be met for the activation of Mathematica to persist?
Q/A.answer: The activation should persist indefinitely as long as the computer is not reinstalled.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of the Mailman List Administration?
Q/A.answer: The primary purpose of the Mailman List Administration is to manage mailing lists, including tasks like adding/removing users, approving subscriptions, and configuring list settings.

Q/A.question: How do users subscribe to a mailing list even if it is private?
Q/A.answer: Users can subscribe to a private mailing list by going to the specific URL for the list, even if it is not advertised or listed.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of the password provided by UMIACS staff?
Q/A.answer: The password is necessary for managing the list, including adding/removing users and approving posts.

Q/A.question: Where can list administrators make changes to membership management?
Q/A.answer: List administrators can manage memberships at the URL: http://lists.umiacs.umd.edu/mailman/admin/LISTNAME/members.

Q/A.question: What should list administrators do if a user goes on vacation?
Q/A.answer: List administrators can change the option to 'nomail' for that user to stop mailing to them until they return.

Q/A.question: What privacy options are available for a mailing list?
Q/A.answer: Privacy options include whether the list is visible to the public, if administrative approval is required to subscribe, who can view the subscriber list, and who can post to the list.

Q/A.question: Can list members see each other's email addresses by default?
Q/A.answer: By default, only list members can see the email addresses of other list members.

Q/A.question: What happens if someone forgets their password?
Q/A.answer: If a user forgets their password, clicking on their email address allows the administrator to send them an email message containing their password.

Q/A.question: What does setting a list to moderated entail?
Q/A.answer: Setting a list to moderated means only certain individuals, like administrators, can post to the list, and all other posts will need approval.

Q/A.question: What is the role of moderators in a mailing list?
Q/A.answer: Moderators are responsible for approving or rejecting messages sent to the list and can also manage certain settings related to member subscriptions.

Q/A.question: What should a list admin do to allow messages from a moderated member without future moderation?
Q/A.answer: The list admin can choose the 'Clear this member's moderate flag' option for that member to automatically allow future messages from them.

Q/A.question: How can messages from non-members be handled?
Q/A.answer: Messages from non-members can be automatically filtered to Accept, Hold, Reject, or Discard based on the admin's settings.

Q/A.question: What resource can list administrators consult for complete Mailman documentation?
Q/A.answer: List administrators can consult the Mailman administrators guide available at http://www.gnu.org/software/mailman/.

Q/A.question: How does Mailman confirm a new subscription to prevent pranks?
Q/A.answer: Mailman sends a confirmation email to the user asking them to confirm their subscription, which requires a reply to complete the subscription process.

Q/A.question: What is the function of the archiving options within a mailing list?
Q/A.answer: The archiving options allow the list admin to decide whether to archive messages sent to the list and who can access those archives.

Q/A.question: What must be considered when being an administrator of a list?
Q/A.answer: Being an administrator does not automatically subscribe you to the list, and administrators should be aware of message delivery times, which can be up to 5 minutes.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of umasks in UNIX?
Q/A.answer: Umasks in UNIX are used to set default file permissions for new files and directories.

Q/A.question: What does SetGID do in UNIX and how is it used for group control?
Q/A.answer: SetGID (Set Group ID) allows users to run an executable with the group permissions of the group that owns the executable, which helps in managing file permissions within a group.

Q/A.question: How can I add a path to my Shell in UNIX?
Q/A.answer: You can add a path to your Shell in UNIX by modifying the PATH environment variable, often by adding a line like 'export PATH=$PATH:/new/path' in the shell configuration file (e.g., .bashrc or .bash_profile).

Q/A.question: Describe a common method to transfer a file in UNIX.
Q/A.answer: A common method to transfer a file in UNIX is by using the 'scp' (secure copy) command, which allows for secure transfer over SSH. For example, 'scp localfile user@remote:/path/to/destination'.

Q/A.question: What would a user typically do if they want to understand the concept of umasks better?
Q/A.answer: A user could refer to the system manual pages by typing 'man umask' in the command line to understand how umasks work and their implications on file permissions.

Q/A.question: Can you explain the relationship between umasks, SetGID, and file permissions?
Q/A.answer: Umasks and SetGID both relate to file permissions: umasks determine the default permissions for new files, while SetGID affects how executable files are run, altering group ownership and permissions during execution.
