Q/A.answer: When selecting the Solstice option, users are prompted to look at the display for instructions on how to connect their device(s) wirelessly.

Q/A.question: What type of information does UMIACS not store on its web servers?
Q/A.answer: Sensitive information.

Q/A.question: How is sensitive information handled upon receipt at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: It is encrypted in memory and sent to a designated email address.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended email encryption/decryption software at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: WinPT (Windows Privacy Tray).

Q/A.question: What is required to use WinPT?
Q/A.answer: GnuPG version 1.4.11 or higher must be installed on the computer.

Q/A.question: Where can GnuPG be downloaded for free?
Q/A.answer: From the GnuPG website at https://www.gnupg.org/.

Q/A.question: What is a keypair in the context of encryption?
Q/A.answer: A keypair consists of a public key used for encryption and a private key used for decryption.

Q/A.question: What are the steps to encrypt/decrypt messages using WinPT?
Q/A.answer: Copy the text to the clipboard, click on the WinPT icon, select the menu item, and follow the prompts.

Q/A.question: How can you send your public key to others?
Q/A.answer: Export your public key and send it to them, never distribute your private key.

Q/A.question: What must be done when accepting sensitive information online, according to UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: It is mandatory to use encrypted messages.

Q/A.question: To whom should the public key be sent for the standard UMIACS setup?
Q/A.answer: Send it to webmaster@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What additional resource is mentioned for an in-depth guide on using WinPT?
Q/A.answer: An over-simplified WinPT Tutorial at http://sebsauvage.net/winpt_en.html.

Q/A.question: What is required to print from user-managed macOS 13.x or later machines?
Q/A.answer: You must be on a UMIACS network directly or connected to the VPN.

Q/A.question: Which section in the System Settings do you need to open to manage printers?
Q/A.answer: Printers & Scanners.

Q/A.question: How can you create a new local printer on macOS?
Q/A.answer: By clicking the Add Printer, Scanner, or Fax... button on the Printers & Scanners page.

Q/A.question: What dialog comes up when you click to add a printer?
Q/A.answer: The Add Printer dialog.

Q/A.question: What protocol should be set when adding a printer using IPP?
Q/A.answer: Internet Printing Protocol - IPP.

Q/A.question: What must you make sure to prefix the queue with when adding a printer?
Q/A.answer: printers/

Q/A.question: What should you do if you need to access more advanced features of a printer?
Q/A.answer: You will need to take extra steps and see the Advanced section at the bottom of the page.

Q/A.question: What should you select after clicking 'Add' when setting up a printer?
Q/A.answer: You will be asked about enabling duplex.

Q/A.question: What is the website to locate your printer's make and model?
Q/A.answer: http://print.umiacs.umd.edu/printers/

Q/A.question: Which option should you select in the 'Printer Software' window?
Q/A.answer: Find your specific make and model of printer and click on it.

Q/A.question: What can you do if you cannot find your printer's make and model?
Q/A.answer: Try downloading the drivers from Apple's website and reinstalling the printer.

Q/A.question: Where are printers with staplers located?
What must you configure to use the stapler while printing?
Q/A.answer: Set 'HP 3-Bin Stapler/Stacker' to 'Mailbox Mode'.

Q/A.question: How can you initiate a print job that uses stapling features?
Q/A.answer: In Preview, select 'Show Details' and then set 'Feature Sets' to 'Finishing'.

Q/A.question: What is required to configure a stored job?
Q/A.answer: Advanced print features must be enabled.

Q/A.question: What should you do to enter a PIN for printing a stored job?
Q/A.answer: Check the box 'Use PIN to Print' and enter a 4-digit number.

Q/A.question: How do you access stored print jobs from the printer?
Q/A.answer: Tap on 'Print from Job Storage' or 'Print > Print from Job Storage' on the Home screen.

Q/A.question: What significant change occurred to Vulcan's compute nodes as of the scheduled maintenance window for August 2023?
Q/A.answer: The compute nodes from Vulcan's previous standalone cluster have folded into Nexus.

Q/A.question: How can users log in to a submission host for the Nexus cluster?
Q/A.answer: Users can SSH to nexusvulcan.umiacs.umd.edu to log in to a submission host.

Q/A.question: What modifications have been made to the job submission commands when transitioning from the standalone Vulcan cluster to the Nexus cluster?
Q/A.answer: The commands from the standalone Vulcan cluster have 'vulcan-' prepended to account and partition names when moved to the Nexus cluster, except for the base account named 'vulcan'.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum number of jobs that a user can submit simultaneously in the vulcan-dpart partition?
Q/A.answer: The maximum submission limit is 500 jobs per user simultaneously.

Q/A.question: Describe the types of GPU nodes available in Vulcan.
Q/A.answer: There are currently 46 GPU nodes available with a mixture of NVIDIA RTX A6000, A5000, A4000, Quadro P6000, GeForce GTX 1080 Ti, RTX 2080 Ti, and Tesla P100 cards.

Q/A.question: What are the three main partitions available for general Vulcan SLURM users?
Q/A.answer: The three main partitions are vulcan-dpart, vulcan-scavenger, and vulcan-cpu.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the scratch storage available to Vulcan users?
Q/A.answer: Scratch data has no data protection, and is intended for temporary storage during compute jobs, with the potential risk of data loss.

Q/A.question: What is the size limit for home directory storage available to each user?
Q/A.answer: Each user has 30GB of home directory storage available.

Q/A.question: What will happen to users' cfahomes directories after February 22, 2023?
Q/A.answer: The cfahomes directories will be retired in a two-phase process, where they will first become read-only on November 17, 2023, and then taken offline on December 21, 2023.

Q/A.question: What command do you use to check your account associations in SLURM?
Q/A.answer: You can use the command 'show_assoc' to check your account associations.

Q/A.question: Which faculty member's account is mentioned as a primary approver for storage allocations?
Q/A.answer: Dr. Shrivastava is mentioned as the primary approver for storage allocations.

Q/A.question: What is the time limit on interactive jobs within the vulcan-ampere partition as of February 29, 2024?
Q/A.answer: There is a 4-hour time limit on interactive jobs within the vulcan-ampere partition.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they need more than 500GB of scratch space?
Q/A.answer: To request more than 500GB, they will need faculty approval and/or a project directory.

Q/A.question: What command can you use to show the current QoS limits for Vulcan?
Q/A.answer: The command 'show_qos' can be used to display the current QoS limits.

Q/A.question: How often are maintenance jobs for local scratch directories run?
Q/A.answer: Maintenance jobs run once a month at 1am, and different nodes run these jobs on different days.

Q/A.question: What type of storage can users request in the UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: Users can request project allocations in the UMIACS Object Store.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the guide mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: The guide is for accessing the UMIACS FTP service using Windows Explorer.

Q/A.question: How can you open Windows Explorer on a Windows machine?
Q/A.answer: You can open Windows Explorer by clicking the folder icon on the taskbar, selecting 'File/Windows Explorer' from the menu, or typing 'Windows Explorer' or 'File Explorer' in the Start menu search box.

Q/A.question: What is the address format to access a user's public folder via FTP?
Q/A.answer: The address format to access a user's public folder is \\umiacs-webftp\ftp-umiacs\pub\<username>.

Q/A.question: Can external collaborators modify files in the public folder?
Q/A.answer: No, external collaborators can only download files published by the owner; they cannot modify files.

Q/A.question: What alternative method can collaborators use to access public folders?
Q/A.answer: Collaborators can access public folders through a web browser by typing ftp://ftp.umiacs.umd.edu/pub/<username>/ in the address bar.

Q/A.question: What do collaborators need to do to download a file from a public folder?
Q/A.answer: Collaborators need to click on the file title to download a published file.

Q/A.question: What type of machines support UMIACS FTP services?
Q/A.answer: The FTP services can be accessed from supported Windows machines.

Q/A.question: Is there any specific instruction for accessing public folders in Windows 10?
Q/A.answer: For Windows 10, you should type 'File Explorer' in the search box to open Windows Explorer.

Q/A.question: What happens if an owner of a public folder wants to modify files?
Q/A.answer: The owner of the public folder can publish and modify files from a supported Windows machine.

Q/A.question: What is the retrieved URL mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: The retrieved URL is 'https://wiki.umiacs.umd.edu/umiacs/index.php?title=FTP/Windows/Explorer&oldid=10696'.

Q/A.question: What types of accounts are mentioned under the Authentication section?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS accounts and collaborator accounts.

Q/A.question: How can a user request an account at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The process for requesting an account is described under the Authentication section, but specific details were not provided in the text.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Operating Systems Support section?
Q/A.answer: It provides a list of operating systems supported at UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What email-related services does UMIACS offer?
Q/A.answer: Email offering at UMIACS and configuring the spam filter.

Q/A.question: What are mailing lists used for in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Mail aliases and Mailman mailing lists.

Q/A.question: What guidance is provided in the Printing section?
Q/A.answer: A printing guide for different operating systems and locations of UMIACS' public printers.

Q/A.question: How can personal devices be backed up according to the Backups section?
Q/A.answer: By using Google Drive.

Q/A.question: What does the Network Attached Storage section describe?
Q/A.answer: It describes NFS home directories and project directories.

Q/A.question: What data storage options are mentioned under Local Data Storage?
Q/A.answer: Local scratch, network scratch, and nfshomes.

Q/A.question: What services are provided under Web Services?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS web hosting services, including hosting a personal website.

Q/A.question: What topics are covered under UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: Getting started on UMIACS' Object Store, including buckets, keys, and how to access the object store.

Q/A.question: What is the subject of the Revision Control (Git) section?
Q/A.answer: It provides a brief introduction to GitLab.

Q/A.question: What programming languages are addressed in the Programming Languages section?
Q/A.answer: A list of commonly used programming languages by the faculty and students at UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What information does the High Performance Computing section provide?
Q/A.answer: Information on different clusters such as Nexus, CML, Vulcan, and the SLURM resource scheduler.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Virtual Private Networking section?
Q/A.answer: Instructions on how to install and configure UMIACS' Pulse Secure VPN.

Q/A.question: How can requests for data destruction be made?
Q/A.answer: By making a request to securely destroy data as mentioned in the Storage Device Destruction section.

Q/A.question: What software is required to complete the Digital Loaner Form provided by UMIACS staff?
Q/A.answer: Adobe Acrobat DC or Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

Q/A.question: Where can Adobe Acrobat DC be obtained for free?
Q/A.answer: From Terpware.

Q/A.question: Is Adobe Acrobat Reader DC free for everyone?
Q/A.answer: Yes, it is free to everyone.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to take when filling out the Digital Loaner Form?
Q/A.answer: Download the form that has been provided by UMIACS staff.

Q/A.question: What should you do after opening the downloaded form in Adobe Acrobat?
Q/A.answer: Click on Tools on the top menu, find Fill & Sign under Forms & Signatures, and click Add and/or Open.

Q/A.question: What specific fields must be filled out when completing the form?
Q/A.answer: At minimum, the Description of Equipment field, and for any equipment with a University Inventory Number or serial number, those fields must also be filled out.

Q/A.question: Can UMIACS staff pre-fill any fields in the Digital Loaner Form?
Q/A.answer: Yes, if you have been in contact with UMIACS Staff previously, they may have pre-filled some of these fields for you.

Q/A.question: What should you do with the signature field in the form?
Q/A.answer: Leave the signature field blank.

Q/A.question: How can you add a signature to the form?
Q/A.answer: Click on Sign on the Fill & Sign top menu, then Add Signature.

Q/A.question: What happens after you save the PDF of the form?
Q/A.answer: You will not be able to edit the form further.

Q/A.question: What should you do after saving the signed form?
Q/A.answer: Attach the signed form to the originating request that prompted staff to direct you to this page.

Q/A.question: What are the primary tools used to access the UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: The primary tools used to access the UMIACS Object Store are S3 desktop clients, UMobj command line utilities, and the built-in web interface.

Q/A.question: What is the suggested method for managing permissions in the UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: Permissions should be managed from the built-in web application at https://obj.umiacs.umd.edu/obj.

Q/A.question: What is Cyberduck and on which operating systems does it function?
Q/A.answer: Cyberduck is a free S3 browser that works on Windows and Mac operating systems, though it is considered nagware that requests donations.

Q/A.question: What required field does Cyberduck ask when connecting to the UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: Cyberduck requires the following fields: Server (obj.umiacs.umd.edu), Access Key ID, and Password (secret key).

Q/A.question: How does WinSCP connect to the UMIACS Object Store?
Q/A.answer: WinSCP connects to the UMIACS Object Store by using the 'Amazon S3' option under File protocol when logging in.

Q/A.question: What are the required fields for logging into WinSCP?
Q/A.answer: The required fields for logging into WinSCP are Host name (obj.umiacs.umd.edu), Access Key ID, and Secret access key.

Q/A.question: What is the main difference between Cyberduck and Transmit?
Q/A.answer: Cyberduck is free but nagware while Transmit is a paid file transfer application for Mac.

Q/A.question: What functionality does Transmit provide for easy file management?
Q/A.answer: Transmit allows users to mount their Obj buckets as local disks, supporting easy drag-and-drop of files.

Q/A.question: What command line client is mentioned for accessing S3-like services?
Q/A.answer: The command line client mentioned for accessing S3-like services is s3cmd.

Q/A.question: What must be configured in the ~/.s3cmd file when using s3cmd?
Q/A.answer: The ~/.s3cmd file must be configured with ACCESS_KEY and SECRET_KEY along with host_base and host_bucket settings.

Q/A.question: What is the MinIO Client used for in relation to UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The MinIO Client is used as a comprehensive command line client for cloud-based storage services, specifically for accessing the UMIACS Object Store.

Q/A.question: What command is used to configure a cloud provider for Obj with the MinIO Client?
Q/A.answer: The command used to configure a cloud provider is 'mc config host add obj http://obj.umiacs.umd.edu <ACCESS_KEY> <SECRET_KEY>'.

Q/A.question: What command would you use to list the contents of a bucket with the MinIO Client?
Q/A.answer: You would use the command '$ mc ls obj/iso' to list the contents of a bucket.

Q/A.question: How can you search for specific files using the MinIO Client?
Q/A.answer: You can search for specific files using the find sub-command with the syntax '$ mc find <bucket_path> --name "*.log"'.

Q/A.question: Where can you find the documentation for the MinIO Client?
Q/A.answer: The full MinIO Client documentation can be found at https://min.io/docs/minio/linux/reference/minio-mc.html.

Q/A.question: What are the prerequisites for connecting to the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: A full UMIACS account, device enrolled with UMIACS Duo for multi-factor authentication, and an established network connection (wired or wireless).

Q/A.question: What client is used to connect to the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: The Pulse Secure Client.

Q/A.question: Where can you download the Pulse Secure Client for Debian-based Linux?
Q/A.answer: The 64 bit Pulse Secure Client .deb for Debian-based Linux can be downloaded from (/umiacs/images/6/66/Pulsesecure_22.7.R3_amd64.deb).

Q/A.question: How do you install the Pulse Secure Client on a Debian-based OS?
Q/A.answer: Run the command 'sudo dpkg -i <insert_filename_here>.deb' after installing necessary dependencies.

Q/A.question: What command is used to install necessary packages before installing the client on a Debian-based OS?
Q/A.answer: Run the command 'sudo apt-get install libnss3-tools net-tools'.

Q/A.question: What is the URL to enter for the VPN server when adding a new connection?
Q/A.answer: 'vpn.umiacs.umd.edu'.

Q/A.question: What should you enter as a secondary password when connecting to the VPN?
Q/A.answer: You can enter 'push', 'phone', or '<press YubiKey>' to receive the secondary authentication.

Q/A.question: What is the result of entering 'push' as a secondary password?
Q/A.answer: It sends a push verification to your Duo connected device.

Q/A.question: What must you do to register a YubiKey for use with the VPN?
Q/A.answer: Interaction with UMIACS Tech Staff is required.

Q/A.question: How can you check the connection status of the VPN?
Q/A.answer: Launch the Pulse Client GUI and select the down arrow to show connection status.

Q/A.question: What methods does UMIACS offer for publishing data?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS offers efficient and secure methods for publishing data, including reports, papers, and more.

Q/A.question: Why is it important to publish data via a faculty member's account or a Labgroup?
Q/A.answer: It reduces the chance of any broken links once a student leaves and their account is archived.

Q/A.question: What is OBJ and what is its primary usage?
Q/A.answer: OBJ, or UMIACS Object Storage, is the preferred method of publishing websites, data, and related information.

Q/A.question: What are LabGroups and what purpose do they serve?
Q/A.answer: LabGroups allow multiple users to upload data to a central shared location, which is useful for collaborative projects.

Q/A.question: How can you make a file publicly available on OBJ?
Q/A.answer: Click the settings cog on the right side of the file, scroll down, and click 'Make Key Public'.

Q/A.question: What files does UMIACS recommend including when publishing a website?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS recommends including an index.html file and an error file for broken links (404).

Q/A.question: What action should be taken if sensitive data is to be published?
Q/A.answer: Sensitive or access-controlled data should be kept in a separate bucket to maintain privacy.

Q/A.question: What should a user click to remove a website configuration on OBJ?
Q/A.answer: A user should click 'Remove Website Configuration' and then 'Make Private'.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of the index.html file when publishing a website on UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The index.html file is necessary for a website's main entry point when configuring hosting for the bucket.

Q/A.question: Where can users find more information about using OBJ?
Q/A.answer: Users can find more information on the OBJ help page at https://obj.umiacs.umd.edu/obj/help.

Q/A.question: What is the function of Mattermost as provided by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Mattermost serves as a trusted on-premise messaging platform that supports direct messaging, teams, public and private channels, extensive search capabilities, and file sharing.

Q/A.question: Where is Mattermost hosted?
Q/A.answer: Mattermost is hosted in one of UMIACS's physical on-premise data centers.

Q/A.question: How does authentication work for logging into Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Mattermost is integrated with the GitLab authentication system, requiring multi-factor authentication (MFA). Users are prompted to log in via GitLab and UMIACS Single Sign-On.

Q/A.question: What options do users have when signing into Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Users will be presented with teams they can join by default, including the option to select the UMIACS Team.

Q/A.question: What provisions exist for faculty, labs, and centers regarding Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Faculty, labs, and centers can request a private Team for their research groups, labs, or centers by contacting staff.

Q/A.question: Where can users find documentation about using Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Extensive documentation is available at https://docs.mattermost.com/guides/user.html.

Q/A.question: What messaging features does Mattermost support?
Q/A.answer: Mattermost supports rich text messaging formatting, including markdown and simple techniques.

Q/A.question: What should users do to download applications for Mattermost?
Q/A.answer: Users can download desktop and mobile applications from https://mattermost.com/download/#mattermostApps, and they need to enter the URL for their service to sign in.

Q/A.question: What happens to teams in Mattermost if there is no activity for six months?
Q/A.answer: Teams will be archived if there is no activity in the team channels for six months.

Q/A.question: What occurs to user account data when UMIACS accounts are archived?
Q/A.answer: User account data will also be archived when their UMIACS accounts are archived.

Q/A.question: Why is it important to keep your browser and email clients up-to-date?
Q/A.answer: It is important to combat security flaws and gain new functionality.

Q/A.question: What are the names of the applications discussed in the instructions on the page?
Q/A.answer: Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird.

Q/A.question: How can you determine the installed version of Firefox or Thunderbird on Windows?
Q/A.answer: By opening the application and selecting 'Help > About Mozilla [application]' from the menu bar.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to enable automatic updates for Mozilla Firefox on Windows?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to options.

Q/A.question: What option should be enabled in the Firefox Updates section to allow automatic updates?
Q/A.answer: Automatically install updates.

Q/A.question: If you do not want to have Mozilla Firefox auto-update, what can you do?
Q/A.answer: You can manually check for updates.

Q/A.question: Which section in Thunderbird settings allows automatic updates?
Q/A.answer: The updates tab.

Q/A.question: What should you do if Firefox or Thunderbird refuses to update using the provided methods?
Q/A.answer: Stop by the HelpDesk and have a technician assist you.

Q/A.question: What is the recommended action if the 'Automatically install updates' option is not enabled in Thunderbird?
Q/A.answer: It is recommended to enable this option.

Q/A.question: What is the final step to update Mozilla Thunderbird on Mac?
Q/A.answer: Click on 'Restart to update Thunderbird' button.

Q/A.question: What is Visual Studio (VS) Code and who developed it?
Q/A.answer: VS Code is a multi-platform source-code editor developed by Microsoft.

Q/A.question: Can VS Code be used with different programming languages?
Q/A.answer: Yes, VS Code can be used with a variety of programming languages.

Q/A.question: What feature allows the base functionality of VS Code to be extended?
Q/A.answer: VS Code can have its functionality extended through extensions available via its marketplace.

Q/A.question: What is advised about using VS Code as a code editor?
Q/A.answer: It is advised to use VS Code strictly as a code editor and avoid file management tasks within the editor.

Q/A.question: What should you not do when using VS Code on submission nodes?
Q/A.answer: You should not open large files (more than a few MB) in VS Code on submission nodes.

Q/A.question: What is a recommended action to take after finishing a session in VS Code?
Q/A.answer: Consider manually killing your server session on the submission node after ending your work.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Remote - SSH extension in VS Code?
Q/A.answer: The Remote - SSH extension allows connections to a VS Code Server session on the submission node(s).

Q/A.question: What common issue may prevent you from SSH'ing to a submission node?
Q/A.answer: If your home directory is full, it may prevent SSH access.

Q/A.question: How can you check if your home directory is full?
Q/A.answer: You can check the status by using the command 'df -h .' in your home directory.

Q/A.question: What happens if many unique files are opened in VS Code on a remote machine?
Q/A.answer: They may remain in RAM for extended periods even if tabs are closed due to the persistence of VS Code Server processes.

Q/A.question: What command can you use in the Command Palette to terminate your VS Code Server session?
Q/A.answer: 'Kill VS Code Server on Host...' is the command used to terminate the session.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you need to open a large file briefly on a submission node?
Q/A.answer: You should clean up your server session on that node as soon as possible after usage.

Q/A.question: Why might one prefer to use command-line programs (like mv/cp/rm) instead of VS Code for file management?
Q/A.answer: Using command-line programs is preferred because they do not cause load spikes that slow down processes on the submission node.

Q/A.question: What is a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) used for when connecting to a submission node?
Q/A.answer: An FQDN is used to specify the submission node you want to connect to via VS Code.

Q/A.question: What is Python and what type of programming language is it?
Q/A.answer: Python is a widely used general-purpose, high-level programming language.

Q/A.question: How can you check your Python path in a shell?
Q/A.answer: You can check your Python path by running the command: bash:~$ python -c 'import sys; print sys.path'.

Q/A.question: What variable is used by Python to determine where to find modules?
Q/A.answer: 'PYTHONPATH' is the variable used by Python to determine where to look for modules.

Q/A.question: What method can be used to install a specific version of Python if it is not available via GNU Modules?
Q/A.answer: You can build it from source as an alternative method.

Q/A.question: What is the difference between the user scheme and the prefix scheme for module installation?
Q/A.answer: The user scheme installs modules into the site userbase, which is included in the PYTHONPATH by default, while the prefix scheme allows a user to install a module into a location of their choice, which must be added to the PYTHONPATH.

Q/A.question: What is a Python Virtual Environment?
Q/A.answer: A Python Virtual Environment is an isolated working copy of Python that allows you to work on a specific project without affecting other projects.

Q/A.question: What command is used to install a module using the user scheme?
Q/A.answer: The command is: bash:~$ python setup.py install --user.

Q/A.question: What is required when installing modules using the prefix scheme?
Q/A.answer: The location where the module is installed must be added to the PYTHONPATH.

Q/A.question: Can you install Python on Windows without Administrator credentials?
Q/A.answer: Yes, you can install your required version of Python on Windows without Administrator credentials.

Q/A.question: Why might you want to install your own modules in Python?
Q/A.answer: You might want to install your own modules if the default set of modules provided with some versions of Python in GNU modules is not sufficient for your needs.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of Windows as mentioned in the wiki?
Q/A.answer: Windows is a desktop and server operating system made by Microsoft.

Q/A.question: What page should you refer to for the list of supported Windows versions?
Q/A.answer: You should see the page titled 'this page' for the list of what Windows versions are currently supported.

Q/A.question: What action can you take if you need to activate Windows on a supported device?
Q/A.answer: You can see Windows Activation if you need to activate Windows on a UMIACS supported desktop or laptop.

Q/A.question: If someone needs to activate Microsoft Office on a UMIACS system, what should they refer to?
Q/A.answer: They should see Microsoft Office Activation.

Q/A.question: What can one find in the Windows Servicing section of the wiki?
Q/A.answer: The Windows Servicing section provides an overview of how UMIACS runs Windows feature updates.

Q/A.question: List at least two programming environments mentioned in the document.
Q/A.answer: Python and Visual Studio are two programming environments mentioned.

Q/A.question: What does the Other Resources section encompass?
Q/A.answer: The Other Resources section includes Windows Accounts, Remote Desktop, Setting File Permissions in Windows, and BitLocker Input Method Editors.

Q/A.question: What is the primary feature of BitLocker as inferred from the context?
Q/A.answer: BitLocker is likely related to security, specifically disk encryption, but the document does not provide detailed information about it.

Q/A.question: Given the information, what could be inferred about UMIACS's support for Windows?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS supports multiple versions of Windows and provides guidelines for activation and servicing.

Q/A.question: Explain the significance of referencing 'this page' in the context of supported Windows versions.
Q/A.answer: Referencing 'this page' implies that there is a dedicated resource that lists the specific versions of Windows that UMIACS currently supports, ensuring users have up-to-date information.

Q/A.question: What department administers the wireless network on the University of Maryland campus?
Q/A.answer: The wireless network is administered by the University of Maryland Department of Information Technology.

Q/A.question: Which email address format is used to connect to the eduroam network?
Q/A.answer: @umd.edu

Q/A.question: What do UMD Directory ID holders need to connect to the wireless network?
Q/A.answer: They need their directory password along with their @umd.edu email address.

Q/A.question: What is the process for connecting to the umd-guest network?
Q/A.answer: Sign up for and connect to the umd-guest network.

Q/A.question: If an individual wants to connect a personal laptop via a wired connection, what should they do?
Q/A.answer: They should send an email to staff@umiacs.umd.edu noting the room number and identification number of the port.

Q/A.question: How can network troubleshooting be approached according to the document?
Q/A.answer: By troubleshooting basic network issues.

Q/A.question: What identifies the wired network ports provided by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The ports are typically identified by having a yellow port (Iribe) or orange port (AVW), along with a 5-character identification string.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they need bulk access to the wireless network?
Q/A.answer: They should contact UMIACS Staff.

Q/A.question: List some related topics mentioned in the document regarding network services.
Q/A.answer: Network/Troubleshooting, Network/VPN, Network/VPN/Android, Network/VPN/IOS, Network/VPN/Ivanti, and others.

Q/A.question: What information is provided in the links included in the document?
Q/A.answer: The links provide instructions and access to various network-related services at the University of Maryland.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of the UMobj suite of utilities?
Q/A.answer: The UMobj suite provides command-line access to the UMIACS Object Store.

Q/A.question: On what operating systems is UMobj preinstalled?
Q/A.answer: UMobj is preinstalled on all UMIACS-supported RHEL8 machines.

Q/A.question: What should users do if they are on non UMIACS-supported hosts?
Q/A.answer: Users are encouraged to use one of the many third-party command line clients.

Q/A.question: When is it recommended to use UMobj?
Q/A.answer: It is recommended to use UMobj if you have a large number of files to upload (hundreds or thousands) or if you are uploading large files (greater than 4GB in size).

Q/A.question: What environmental variables are recommended for setting credentials?
Q/A.answer: It is recommended to set OBJ_ACCESS_KEY_ID, OBJ_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, and OBJ_SERVER as environmental variables.

Q/A.question: Where can users find their credentials for the Object Store?
Q/A.answer: Users can find their credentials on the user page of the Object Store web interface.

Q/A.question: Provide an example command to set credentials in the bash shell.
Q/A.answer: export OBJ_ACCESS_KEY_ID="<ACCESS_KEY>"; export OBJ_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY="<SECRET_KEY>"; export OBJ_SERVER="obj.umiacs.umd.edu".

Q/A.question: How can users set environment variables in tcsh?
Q/A.answer: Users can use 'setenv OBJ_ACCESS_KEY_ID "<ACCESS_KEY>"; setenv OBJ_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY "<SECRET_KEY>"; setenv OBJ_SERVER "obj.umiacs.umd.edu".'

Q/A.question: Where can users find detailed usage information for UMobj?
Q/A.answer: For detailed usage information, users can refer to the GitLab page for umobj.

Q/A.question: What is a resource users can check for an example of how to use UMobj?
Q/A.answer: Users can check UMobj/Example for an example of how to use UMobj.

Q/A.question: What does SCP stand for and what is its primary function?
Q/A.answer: SCP stands for Secure Copy, and its primary function is to securely copy data between two computers using SSH.

Q/A.question: Which operating systems support the SCP command mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: The SCP command works under Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Ubuntu Linux, and macOS.

Q/A.question: Provide an example of an SCP command to copy a file from a local machine to a remote machine.
Q/A.answer: An example command is 'scp source_file.txt jayid07@nexusstaff00:target_file.txt'.

Q/A.question: In the given SCP command, what is the significance of the hostname and username?
Q/A.answer: The hostname and username are required to specify the remote machine and user where the file is being copied to.

Q/A.question: What command is used in SCP to transfer a file from a remote machine back to the local machine?
Q/A.answer: The same 'scp' command is used, but the source file reference would be a path to the remote machine followed by a local target filename.

Q/A.question: How does the syntax of SCP compare to the UNIX command 'cp'?
Q/A.answer: The syntax of SCP is very similar to the UNIX command 'cp', with the addition of a hostname and username in SCP.

Q/A.question: What is the Windows equivalent of SCP mentioned in the text?
Q/A.answer: The Windows equivalent mentioned is WinSCP, which is already installed on UMIACS supported Windows hosts.

Q/A.question: What URL is provided for downloading WinSCP?
Q/A.answer: The URL for downloading WinSCP is http://winscp.net/eng/download.php.

Q/A.question: What is the main source of information used for Secure Copy?
Q/A.answer: The main source of information for Secure Copy is OpenSSH, as mentioned in the further information section.

Q/A.question: What is the significance of SSH in the context of SCP?
Q/A.answer: SSH (Secure Shell) provides the protocol for secure communication over a network, which SCP utilizes to securely transfer files.

Q/A.question: What is the most common environment variable discussed in the document?
Q/A.answer: The most common variable is the PATH variable.

Q/A.question: How can you view your current PATH variable in the shell?
Q/A.answer: You can see your PATH variable by using the built-in echo command with the syntax $ echo $PATH.

Q/A.question: What character must be prefixed to environment variables when printing them out in the shell?
Q/A.answer: You must prefix the variable with the $ sign.

Q/A.question: What command can you use to append a new path to the existing PATH variable in tcsh?
Q/A.answer: You can use the command 'setenv PATH ${PATH}:/opt/UMtorque/bin' to append a new path.

Q/A.question: What is the correct command to append a new path to the PATH variable in bash?
Q/A.answer: The command is 'export PATH=${PATH}:/opt/UMtorque/bin'.

Q/A.question: Why is it generally preferred to append to the PATH variable instead of replacing it?
Q/A.answer: Because replacing it fully will most likely decrease the functionality of your shell.

Q/A.question: What steps are required to modify the Windows PATH Environmental Variable?
Q/A.answer: Go to Control Panel, click on User Accounts, then click Change my environment variables. Choose the PATH variable under User Variables for <username>, and if none, click New and put 'PATH' for the Variable name. Edit it to append the location you want to add.

Q/A.question: How can you verify that the PATH variable in Windows has been modified properly?
Q/A.answer: By opening a new Command Prompt and typing in 'PATH', the updated PATH should be printed.

Q/A.question: Where does UMIACS maintain conference rooms?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS maintains conference rooms in the Brendan Iribe Center as well as a few in the Atlantic building.

Q/A.question: What is the name of the center that houses some of the conference rooms managed by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The Brendan Iribe Center.

Q/A.question: Are there any conference rooms located in the Atlantic building?
Q/A.answer: Yes, UMIACS has a few conference rooms in the Atlantic building.

Q/A.question: What is the URL for more information about UMIACS conference rooms?
Q/A.answer: https://wiki.umiacs.umd.edu/umiacs/index.php/ConferenceRooms

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the UMIACS wiki page referenced?
Q/A.answer: The purpose of the page is to provide information about the conference rooms maintained by UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What specific sections are mentioned in the context of conference rooms?
Q/A.answer: Iribe/ConferenceRooms and ATL/ConferenceRooms.

Q/A.question: What does the acronym UMIACS stand for?
Q/A.answer: The specific meaning is not provided in the text; context is needed to define UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What are the prerequisites for using the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: You need a full UMIACS account, a device enrolled with UMIACS Duo for multi-factor authentication, and an established network connection (mobile data or wireless).

Q/A.question: Where can the Pulse Secure Client be downloaded?
Q/A.answer: The Pulse Secure Client can be downloaded for free from the App Store for iOS and Google Play for Android.

Q/A.question: What is the URL you need to enter when configuring the Pulse Secure Client?
Q/A.answer: The URL to enter is vpn.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What initial action must you take when launching the Pulse Secure Client for the first time?
Q/A.answer: You must accept its license agreement by clicking 'Accept' to continue.

Q/A.question: What information do you need to provide to configure a new VPN connection?
Q/A.answer: You need to provide the Connection Name (UMIACS VPN) and your UMIACS username.

Q/A.question: What should you do after configuring the Pulse Secure Client?
Q/A.answer: After configuration, you can hit the 'Connect' button, enter your UMIACS password, and hit 'Sign in' to start the VPN connection.

Q/A.question: How can you verify that you are connected to the VPN?
Q/A.answer: Your connection status is verified by the VPN symbol in the top status bar.

Q/A.question: What steps should you follow to disconnect from the VPN?
Q/A.answer: To stop the VPN tunnel, you should click 'Disconnect'.

Q/A.question: What significant change occurred to the MBRC cluster as of mid 2023?
Q/A.answer: The compute nodes from MBRC's previous standalone cluster have folded into Nexus.

Q/A.question: What does the Nexus cluster provide for UMIACS and CSD faculty?
Q/A.answer: A large pool of compute resources made possible through college-level funding.

Q/A.question: What are the SSH access points to the submission hosts in MBRC?
Q/A.answer: The actual submission hosts are nexusmbrc00.umiacs.edu and nexusmbrc01.umiacs.edu.

Q/A.question: What naming convention is used for the compute nodes in the MBRC partition?
Q/A.answer: The compute nodes are named mbrc##.

Q/A.question: What is the special QoS available specifically for the MBRC partition?
Q/A.answer: The huge-long QoS allows for longer jobs using higher overall resources.

Q/A.question: What must users specify to submit jobs to the MBRC partition?
Q/A.answer: Users must specify --partition=mbrc and --account=mbrc.

Q/A.question: What happens if all available cores or RAM are in use in the MBRC partition?
Q/A.answer: Your job may need to wait if all available cores/RAM (or GPUs) are in use.

Q/A.question: Who is the point of contact for allocating storage for projects in the MBRC Cluster?
Q/A.answer: Jonathan Heagerty is the point of contact for allocating requested/required storage.

Q/A.question: What type of network storage allocation does the MBRC Cluster use?
Q/A.answer: Network storage is allocated on a project by project basis.

Q/A.question: What information is required when requesting storage from the MBRC staff?
Q/A.answer: Name of user requesting storage, name of project, collaborators, storage size, and length of time for storage.

Q/A.question: What are the two types of webspace mentioned in the Services/Web section?
Q/A.answer: Individual user webspace and Lab Specific WebSpace.

Q/A.question: What should users do to get more information about Lab Specific WebSpace?
Q/A.answer: Users should contact staff for additional details.

Q/A.question: Is there documentation available for MediaWiki according to the page?
Q/A.answer: Documentation is coming soon.

Q/A.question: What is the title of the section discussed in the wiki page?
Q/A.answer: Section: Services/Web.

Q/A.question: What university's information is being represented on the web page?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS (University of Maryland Institute for Advanced Computer Studies).

Q/A.question: What is the primary role of the Nexus in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The Nexus is the combined scheduler of resources in UMIACS.

Q/A.question: Which resource manager is used for Nexus?
Q/A.answer: SLURM is the resource manager for Nexus.

Q/A.question: How are users organized within Nexus?
Q/A.answer: Users are arranged into a number of SLURM accounts based on faculty, lab, or center investments.

Q/A.question: What is required before accessing Nexus if you don't have an account?
Q/A.answer: You need to see Accounts for information on getting a full UMIACS account.

Q/A.question: What determines a user's access to the submission nodes for Nexus resources?
Q/A.answer: Access is determined by the user's account sponsor's department, center, or lab affiliation.

Q/A.question: What is required for multi-factor authentication in UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Multi-factor authentication is required through the Duo instance specified for UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What commands are used to submit SLURM jobs?
Q/A.answer: SLURM jobs are submitted using either `srun` for interactive jobs or `sbatch` for batch jobs.

Q/A.question: What does SLURM use partitions for?
Q/A.answer: Partitions act as job queues which can restrict size, time, and user limits.

Q/A.question: Name a partition that is available to all UMIACS and CSD faculty and graduate students.
Q/A.answer: Nexus/Tron is a pool of resources available to all UMIACS and CSD faculty and graduate students.

Q/A.question: What is Job QoS in Nexus?
Q/A.answer: Job QoS provides limits on the size of jobs that you can run.

Q/A.question: How much home directory storage is available per user?
Q/A.answer: Each user has 30GB of home directory storage available.

Q/A.question: What types of scratch directories exist in Nexus?
Q/A.answer: There are network scratch directories and local scratch directories.

Q/A.question: What is the maximum number of submitted jobs allowed per user in a partition?
Q/A.answer: The maximum number of submitted jobs per user in a partition is 500.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they require more scratch space than the default allocation?
Q/A.answer: A user may request a permanent increase of up to 400GB total space without faculty approval, but if more is needed, faculty approval is necessary.

Q/A.question: What is required for a project allocation request?
Q/A.answer: A project allocation request requires the project name, description, size, length in days, and details of other users needing access.

Q/A.question: Where can datasets be accessed in Nexus?
Q/A.answer: Read-only dataset storage can be accessed at /fs/nexus-datasets.

Q/A.question: What does UMIACS recommend for storing important data?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS recommends that any and all important data be stored on a redundant, backed-up file server.

Q/A.question: How is user data backed up for Windows hosts at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: For supported, UMIACS-managed hosts, user data on the C drive is automatically backed up nightly using the Institute's backup system.

Q/A.question: What happens to data stored on internal or external hard drives attached to a non-C partition on a UMIACS-managed host?
Q/A.answer: Drives or partitions other than C are not backed up.

Q/A.question: What is the directory path for the NFS home directory provided for UNIX users at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: /nfshomes/username

Q/A.question: What quota is assigned to users for their home directory in UNIX storage at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: Users are given a 30GB quota, which is non-expandable.

Q/A.question: Can UNIX machines at UMIACS use local storage for permanent storage?
Q/A.answer: No, these directories may not be used as permanent storage for unique, important data.

Q/A.question: What is the potential risk of data loss in the /tmp directory?
Q/A.answer: The /tmp directory is at risk for data loss or corruption as it is regularly used by system processes and services for temporary storage.

Q/A.question: What is UMIACS's stance on using locally attached storage devices like USB drives?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS discourages the use of locally attached network storage when any other option is available due to their vulnerability to data loss or theft.

Q/A.question: What is the naming convention for network-attached storage used for scratch/temporary storage?
Q/A.answer: These shares are named in the same manner as local scratch or temporary storage, such as /fs/lab-scratch or /lab/scratch0.

Q/A.question: What command is used to show descriptive file system information on UNIX?
Q/A.answer: The command 'df' is used to show descriptive file system information.

Q/A.question: How can you view the current memory (RAM) usage on a UNIX system?
Q/A.answer: You can use the 'free' command to show current memory usage.

Q/A.question: What command displays quota information in UNIX, and what is its basic usage?
Q/A.answer: The command 'quota' displays quota information, with usage: quota [-guqvswim] [-l | [-Q | -A]] [-F quotaformat] ...

Q/A.question: What is the function of the 'iostat' command in UNIX?
Q/A.answer: 'iostat' shows drive utilization and other utilizations.

Q/A.question: What installation method is no longer supported by UMIACS for MongoDB?
Q/A.answer: Due to changes in their licensing a few years ago, UMIACS is no longer supporting MongoDB.

Q/A.question: Where can you find the instructions for installing MongoDB as a tarball?
Q/A.answer: You can find the instructions for installing MongoDB as a tarball at https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-red-hat-tarball/.

Q/A.question: What must you set when creating a custom mongod.conf configuration file?
Q/A.answer: You must set a custom path for systemPath and dbPath, which must be directories that you own.

Q/A.question: What are the recommended platform and package type for downloading MongoDB?
Q/A.answer: The recommended platform is RedHat / CentOS 7.0, and the package type is tgz.

Q/A.question: What command is used to start the mongo server with a custom configuration file?
Q/A.answer: The command to start the mongo server is '/path/to/bin/mongod --config /path/to/mongod.conf'.

Q/A.question: How do you stop the mongo server?
Q/A.answer: You stop the mongo server with the command '/path/to/bin/mongod --config /path/to/mongod.conf --shutdown'.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the mongo client, and how is it started?
Q/A.answer: The mongo client is used to interact with the MongoDB server, and it is started with the command '/path/to/bin/mongo'.

Q/A.question: List the two key configurations that must be set in the custom mongod.conf file.
Q/A.answer: The two key configurations that must be set are systemPath and dbPath.

Q/A.question: What is the URL for the MongoDB Community download page?
Q/A.answer: The URL for the MongoDB Community download page is https://www.mongodb.com/try/download/community.

Q/A.question: Why is it important that the directories for systemPath and dbPath be owned by the user?
Q/A.answer: It is important that the directories for systemPath and dbPath be owned by the user to ensure permission to read and write data in those directories.

Q/A.question: What is the primary purpose of UMIACS' Object Store?
Q/A.answer: The primary purpose of UMIACS' Object Store is to host websites.

Q/A.question: What files can you specify in the website configuration for a hosted website in your bucket?
Q/A.answer: You can specify an index file and an error file in the website configuration.

Q/A.question: What happens to the visibility of a bucket when a website configuration is set?
Q/A.answer: Setting up a website configuration will automatically set the visibility of your bucket to public.

Q/A.question: How can you disable a website that you are hosting?
Q/A.answer: You can disable a website by removing the website configuration on the bucket settings page or using command-line instructions.

Q/A.question: What are the three methods to host a website in OBJ?
Q/A.answer: The three methods to host a website in OBJ are using the Web Interface, using the UMobj CLI, and using a Graphical S3 Client.

Q/A.question: Which command is used to create a bucket using the UMobj CLI?
Q/A.answer: The command used to create a bucket is 'mkobj <bucket_name>'.

Q/A.question: What additional step must be taken in Cyberduck when setting up website hosting?
Q/A.answer: In Cyberduck, you must leave a checkmark next to 'Enable Website Configuration (HTTP) Distribution'.

Q/A.question: How can you access a website hosted in UMIACS' Object Store?
Q/A.answer: You can access the website using the URL format https://<Bucket_name>.umiacs.io.

Q/A.question: What should you update in your UMIACS Directory page to set your bucket as your personal UMIACS webpage?
Q/A.answer: You should update the Home Page attribute to https://<Bucket_name>.umiacs.io.

Q/A.question: What is the first step in the web interface method for hosting a website?
Q/A.answer: The first step is to log into OBJ and create a bucket.

Q/A.question: What are the two methods mentioned for installing Python?
Q/A.answer: The two methods mentioned for installing Python are via .exe and MSI installers.

Q/A.question: What versions of Python no longer have MSI installers available?
Q/A.answer: MSI installers have been discontinued for Python version 3.5 and above.

Q/A.question: What should you do after downloading the Python application via .exe?
Q/A.answer: After downloading, you should click run to run the installer and select 'Install Now'. Make sure to uncheck the 'Install launcher for all users' box.

Q/A.question: Where can you download the Python Windows MSI installer?
Q/A.answer: The Python Windows MSI installer can be downloaded from https://www.python.org/download/.

Q/A.question: What directory should you set as your home directory when installing via MSI?
Q/A.answer: You should set a home directory such as C:\Users\[YOURUSERNAME]\Documents\Pythonx.x.x, where x represents the version number.

Q/A.question: How can you access Python from the command line after installation via MSI?
Q/A.answer: To access Python from the command line, you need to add the python folder to your Path environment variable.

Q/A.question: What steps should you take to add Python to the Path environment variable?
Q/A.answer: Navigate to Control Panel -> System and Security -> System, select Advanced system settings, click on the Environment Variables button, check if a Variable called Path exists, and if it does, add the python directory to its end, separated by a semicolon.

Q/A.question: What is one way to install Python modules as provided in the text?
Q/A.answer: Python modules can be installed by running the command 'python setup.py install' from the module directory if the python directory is in your path.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you want to use Visual Studio with Python?
Q/A.answer: You need to configure Python to work with Visual Studio by editing the msvc9compiler.py file to update the toolskey and mfinfo related lines.

Q/A.question: What is the first step to download and install the easy_install graphical installer?
Q/A.answer: The first step is to download the easy_install graphical installer from https://bootstrap.pypa.io/ez_setup.py.

Q/A.question: Where will the installed files from easy_install typically be located?
Q/A.answer: The installed files should be located in C:\Path\To\Python\Folder\..\Scripts.

Q/A.question: Which Python module is specifically mentioned for installation in the text?
Q/A.answer: NumPy is specifically mentioned for installation in the text.

Q/A.question: What is the link to install NumPy?
Q/A.answer: NumPy can be installed with the installer found at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/numpy/.

Q/A.question: What is the command line syntax to install a module using easy_install?
Q/A.answer: The syntax is: C:\Path\To\Python\Folder\..\Scripts\easy_install.exe module_Name, where module_Name is the name of the module you want to install.

Q/A.question: What versions of Visual Studio are referred to in the configuration steps?
Q/A.answer: The version referred to is Visual Studio 2012, indicated by the toolskey value that corresponds to the version number.

Q/A.question: What do Barracuda spam firewalls manage?
Q/A.answer: Barracuda spam firewalls manage all inbound and outbound email traffic.

Q/A.question: What additional capabilities do Barracuda spam firewalls provide?
Q/A.answer: They provide additional virus and spam filtering capabilities.

Q/A.question: What is one common task you can perform related to spam?
Q/A.answer: You can manage your spam quarantine.

Q/A.question: Name two other common tasks that can be managed using Barracuda.
Q/A.answer: You can manage your Allow list and Block lists.

Q/A.question: What filtering method is mentioned alongside Allow and Block lists?
Q/A.answer: Bayesian filtering is mentioned.

Q/A.question: Where can you find the user guide for Barracuda Email Security Service?
Q/A.answer: You can find it at https://campus.barracuda.com/product/essentials/doc/3211272/barracuda-email-security-service-user-guide/

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of managing an Allow list in Barracuda?
Q/A.answer: The Allow list is used to specify which email addresses or domains are permitted to bypass spam filtering.

Q/A.question: How does Bayesian filtering contribute to spam management?
Q/A.answer: Bayesian filtering helps in classifying emails as spam or not spam based on probability calculations.

Q/A.question: What type of information can be found at the URL linked for managing Allow and Block lists?
Q/A.answer: The URL provides a user guide with instructions on how to manage Allow lists, Block lists, and Bayesian filtering.

Q/A.question: Why is managing a spam quarantine important?
Q/A.answer: Managing a spam quarantine is important to review and release emails that may have been incorrectly marked as spam.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of collaboration tools according to the page?
Q/A.answer: Collaboration tools are designed to improve the ease of sharing and modifying data with a group of people.

Q/A.question: Name one of the current offerings listed in the collaboration section.
Q/A.answer: GitLab

Q/A.question: What features does GitLab provide?
Q/A.answer: GitLab is a web-based git repository manager that includes wiki and issue tracking features.

Q/A.question: What type of storage is mentioned in the current offerings?
Q/A.answer: Block storage

Q/A.question: How does the page suggest collaboration tools function in relation to group activities?
Q/A.answer: They function to enhance the ease of sharing and modifying data among group members.

Q/A.question: What platform is mentioned that has wiki capabilities?
Q/A.answer: GitLab

Q/A.question: Explain how GitLab's issue tracking feature could facilitate collaboration.
Q/A.answer: GitLab's issue tracking feature allows team members to report, track, and resolve issues collaboratively, improving project management and communication.

Q/A.question: Is there an indication of the types of data that can be shared using collaboration tools?
Q/A.answer: No specific types of data are mentioned, just the general capability of sharing and modifying data.

Q/A.question: Why might block storage be relevant for collaboration?
Q/A.answer: Block storage is relevant for collaboration as it provides a scalable and efficient method to store large amounts of data that can be accessed and modified by multiple users.

Q/A.question: What does the title 'Services/Collaboration' imply about the content presented?
Q/A.answer: It implies that the content is focused on the services related to collaborative tools and technologies offered by UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What is Apptainer, and how does it differ from Docker?
Q/A.answer: Apptainer is a container platform that does not elevate the privileges of a user running the container, unlike Docker, which typically requires a daemon with administrative level privileges, making it less suitable for multi-tenant hosts like UMIACS.

Q/A.question: What command can you use to check the current version of Apptainer?
Q/A.answer: You can check the current version of Apptainer by running the command 'apptainer --version'.

Q/A.question: What was Apptainer previously branded as?
Q/A.answer: Apptainer was previously branded as Singularity.

Q/A.question: What must you have in order to create images from definition files in Apptainer?
Q/A.answer: You need to have administrative rights to create images from definition files.

Q/A.question: What directories are suggested for setting up alternate cache and temporary directories when pulling large images?
Q/A.answer: The suggested directories for cache and temporary files are '/scratch0' or any large enough local scratch directory, network scratch directory, or project directory.

Q/A.question: In the example command '$ apptainer pull cuda12.2.2.sif docker://nvidia/cuda:12.2.2-base-ubi8', what is being pulled?
Q/A.answer: The command is pulling a Docker image of NVIDIA CUDA version 12.2.2 and converting it to an SIF file named 'cuda12.2.2.sif'.

Q/A.question: What is essential to specify when running a container that requires access to GPUs?
Q/A.answer: You need to specify the '--nv' flag when running a container that requires access to GPUs.

Q/A.question: Where can example containers based on the pytorch_docker project be found in the Nexus environment?
Q/A.answer: Example containers based on the pytorch_docker project can be found in '/fs/nexus-containers/pytorch'.

Q/A.question: What command is used to exec an interactive session with GPUs and binding a specific Nexus scratch directory?
Q/A.answer: The command used is 'apptainer exec --nv --bind /fs/nexus-scratch/username:/fs/nexus-scratch/username /fs/nexus-containers/pytorch/pytorch_1.13.0+cu117.sif bash'.

Q/A.question: What format are portable images in Apptainer stored as, and where can they be shared?
Q/A.answer: Portable images in Apptainer are stored as .sif files, which can be copied and shared. Nexus maintains some shared containers in '/fs/nexus-containers'.

Q/A.question: What are the steps in the provided Docker workflow example for using pytorch_docker?
Q/A.answer: The steps are: Run Docker on a laptop to create the image or use Podman on a UMIACS-supported system, tag the image, push it to your repository, then pull the image onto a workstation/cluster and run it with your data.

Q/A.question: What is the current name of the Pulse Secure Client as of August 14th, 2022?
Q/A.answer: Ivanti Secure Access Client.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of a virtual private network (VPN)?
Q/A.answer: A VPN extends a private network across a public network, enabling users to send and receive data as if their devices were directly connected to the private network.

Q/A.question: What type of VPN does UMIACS currently provide?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS currently provides VPN access through an Ivanti Connect Secure SSL VPN.

Q/A.question: Who is eligible for VPN access through UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: All users except class accounts are eligible for VPN access.

Q/A.question: What is mandatory to connect using the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: Enrollment in Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is mandatory.

Q/A.question: What can users access once connected to the UMIACS VPN?
Q/A.answer: Users can access the Remote Desktop client to access a Windows machine and other non-public UMIACS resources.

Q/A.question: What are the sections mentioned regarding getting connected to the VPN?
Q/A.answer: The sections include Client Setup, VPN Troubleshooting, and Multi-Factor Authentication.

Q/A.question: List the operating systems mentioned for configuring a VPN connection.
Q/A.answer: Windows, macOS, and Linux.

Q/A.question: What mobile device operating systems are mentioned for VPN configuration?
Q/A.answer: iOS and Android.

Q/A.question: What issue does the VPN Troubleshooting section address?
Q/A.answer: The VPN Troubleshooting section addresses common VPN issues.

Q/A.question: What is the link provided for more information about the Ivanti Secure Access Client?
Q/A.answer: https://www.ivanti.com/products/connect-secure-vpn

Q/A.question: Is there any text currently available on the UMIACS Privacy Policy page?
Q/A.answer: No, there is currently no text on the UMIACS Privacy Policy page.

Q/A.question: What can users do if they want to find information about the UMIACS Privacy Policy?
Q/A.answer: Users can search for the page title in other pages or review the related logs.

Q/A.question: Do users have permission to create the UMIACS Privacy Policy page?
Q/A.answer: No, users do not have permission to create this page.

Q/A.question: What is the retrieved URL from which the information is sourced?
Q/A.answer: The retrieved URL is 'https://wiki.umiacs.umd.edu/umiacs/index.php/UMIACS:Privacy_policy'.

Q/A.question: What are the two main configuration files for Bash?
Q/A.answer: ~/.bash_profile and ~/.bashrc

Q/A.question: In what scenario is ~/.bash_profile used?
Q/A.answer: It is used for login shells.

Q/A.question: What type of shells use ~/.bashrc?
Q/A.answer: Interactive shells.

Q/A.question: How can a user see a complete explanation of Bash features?
Q/A.answer: By typing 'man bash' in the terminal or referring to the Bash Reference Manual.

Q/A.question: What command is used to view the current paths in the terminal?
Q/A.answer: echo $PATH

Q/A.question: How do you add a new path to the current PATH environment variable?
Q/A.answer: By using the command 'export PATH=${PATH}:/the/new/path'.

Q/A.question: Why is the order of paths in the PATH variable important?
Q/A.answer: Because the path is looked up left to right, controlling the order that programs are found.

Q/A.question: Can you name one resource for further reading on Bash?
Q/A.answer: The Bash Reference Manual at http://www.gnu.org/s/bash/manual/bash.html.

Q/A.question: What are the two types of mailing lists mentioned in the UMIACS page?
Q/A.answer: The two types of mailing lists are simple mailing lists in LDAP (also known as mailaliases) and Mailman mailing lists.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the Mailaliases?
Q/A.answer: Mailaliases are simple email redirects that allow for <listnamehere>@umiacs.umd.edu to be forwarded to a set list of email addresses.

Q/A.question: Who should be contacted to create a mailing list at UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The HelpDesk should be contacted if someone would like either type of mailing list created.

Q/A.question: What is a characteristic of Mailman mailing lists compared to Mailaliases?
Q/A.answer: Mailman mailing lists are more complicated and have a robust set of administrative tools.

Q/A.question: What is the URL to the Mailman List Administrators Guide?
Q/A.answer: The URL to the Mailman List Administrators Guide is not provided in the text, but it is referenced as part of the Mailman features.

Q/A.question: In what scenario are Mailaliases most ideal according to the page?
Q/A.answer: Mailaliases are ideal for situations where there is a set number of addresses and no membership changes are needed, along with no requirement for moderation.

Q/A.question: What element of the page indicates that the information might have been updated or retrieved from a specific version?
Q/A.answer: The section 'Retrieved from' includes a URL indicating it was retrieved from a specific version of the page with an oldid parameter.

Q/A.question: Explain the context of the phrase 'Jump to navigation Jump to search' as it appears at the beginning of the text.
Q/A.answer: The phrase 'Jump to navigation Jump to search' represents common web navigation features that provide users specific links for navigating the wiki page.

Q/A.question: What does the term 'Mailman FAQ' refer to, and how is it related to Mailman mailing lists?
Q/A.answer: The 'Mailman FAQ' refers to a frequently asked questions section that likely provides additional information about Mailman mailing lists, including usage and troubleshooting.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of the GAMMA lab mentioned in the document?
Q/A.answer: The GAMMA lab has a partition of GPU nodes available in the Nexus for members to run non-interruptible jobs.

Q/A.question: What types of users have access to the GAMMA GPU nodes?
Q/A.answer: Only GAMMA lab members are able to run non-interruptible jobs on the GAMMA GPU nodes.

Q/A.question: Describe the special submission host for the GAMMA lab.
Q/A.answer: The GAMMA lab has a special submission host called nexusgamma00.umiacs.umd.edu, which has additional local storage available.

Q/A.question: What should users avoid doing on the login node?
Q/A.answer: Users should not run anything on the login node and should instead allocate themselves machines on the compute nodes.

Q/A.question: What additional job Quality of Service (QoS) does the GAMMA partition provide?
Q/A.answer: The additional job QoS provided for the GAMMA partition is called 'huge-long', which allows for longer jobs using higher overall resources.

Q/A.question: What is the GrpTRES limit for jobs on the GAMMA partition?
Q/A.answer: The GrpTRES limit is 100% of the available cores/RAM on the partition-specific nodes plus 50% of the available cores/RAM on legacy nodes in aggregate.

Q/A.question: How many CPU cores and GPUs does the A5000 GPU node have?
Q/A.answer: The A5000 GPU node has 32 CPU cores and 8 GPUs.

Q/A.question: What command is used to submit an interactive job as described in the example section?
Q/A.answer: The command is '$ srun --pty --gres=gpu:8 --account=gamma --partition=gamma --qos=huge-long bash'.

Q/A.question: What is the storage capacity of a user’s home directory in GAMMA?
Q/A.answer: Users have 30GB of home directory storage available in GAMMA.

Q/A.question: How can users check their quota on their home directory?
Q/A.answer: To check the quota on their home directory, users can use the command 'df -h ~'.

Q/A.question: What are the allocation limits for project directories in GAMMA?
Q/A.answer: Users can request project-based allocations for up to 8TB and up to 180 days with approval from a GAMMA faculty member.

Q/A.question: What should a user do if they no longer need their storage allocation?
Q/A.answer: If a user no longer needs the storage allocation, they must relocate all desired data within two weeks of the end of the allocation period.

Q/A.question: How much scratch space is allocated for users via NFS from the network scratch directory?
Q/A.answer: Users are allocated 100GB of scratch space via NFS from the /gammascratch/$username directory.

Q/A.question: What is the difference between local scratch directories and network scratch directories?
Q/A.answer: Local scratch directories are not available over NFS and lack backups and snapshots, while network scratch directories are accessible over NFS but also lack data protection.

Q/A.question: What kind of filesystems can users store their data in during compute jobs?
Q/A.answer: Users can store their data in local scratch directories and network scratch directories during compute jobs.

Q/A.question: What is the total available space in the NVMe scratch file system on nexusgamma00.umiacs.umd.edu?
Q/A.answer: The total space in the NVMe scratch file system on nexusgamma00.umiacs.umd.edu is 20TB.

Q/A.question: What do users need to do in order to remove files from the /scratch1 directory?
Q/A.answer: Users need to manually remove files from the /scratch1 directory once they are no longer needed.

Q/A.question: What type of storage is available for datasets in GAMMA?
Q/A.answer: GAMMA has read-only dataset storage available at /fs/gamma-datasets.

Q/A.question: How can users request datasets to be curated in GAMMA?
Q/A.answer: Users can request datasets to be curated and available by following the provided instruction on the page.

Q/A.question: What is the main purpose of the guide found in the document?
Q/A.answer: The guide explains how to access the UMIACS FTP service using macOS Finder.

Q/A.question: How can a user open macOS Finder as mentioned in the guide?
Q/A.answer: A user can open macOS Finder by clicking on the macOS Finder icon on the dock at the bottom of the desktop.

Q/A.question: What keyboard shortcuts are mentioned for accessing different features in macOS Finder?
Q/A.answer: Press Command + Shift + G to bring up the address bar and Command + K to open the 'Connect to Server' window.

Q/A.question: What can the owner of the public folder do according to the document?
Q/A.answer: The owner of the public folder can publish and modify files from a supported machine.

Q/A.question: What actions can external collaborators take regarding the public folder?
Q/A.answer: External collaborators can only download files published by the owner.

Q/A.question: What steps must be taken to access your public folder as an owner?
Q/A.answer: First, bring up the address bar using Command + Shift + G, then type in '/fs/ftp/pub/<username>' where <username> is replaced with your actual username.

Q/A.question: Describe how an external collaborator connects to the public folder using Finder.
Q/A.answer: An external collaborator should open the 'Connect to Server' window using Command + K, enter the address 'ftp://ftp.umiacs.umd.edu/pub/<username>', replace <username> with the desired collaborator's username, choose to connect as a guest, and then click 'Connect'.

Q/A.question: What information must be entered in the server address bar to connect to an external collaborator's folder?
Q/A.answer: The address 'ftp://ftp.umiacs.umd.edu/pub/<username>' must be entered, replacing <username> with the desired collaborator's username.

Q/A.question: What should be done after entering the server address to connect as a guest?
Q/A.answer: After entering the server address, you should choose to connect as a guest and then click 'Connect' once more.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the datasets hosted by UMIACS?
Q/A.answer: The purpose is to provide publicly accessible datasets in a well-defined location to de-duplicate their use elsewhere, thus reducing overall storage usage.

Q/A.question: What are the dataset directories mentioned in the document?
Q/A.answer: The dataset directories mentioned are CML, GAMMA, Nexus, and Vulcan.

Q/A.question: Who is the faculty approver for the CML dataset?
Q/A.answer: The faculty approver for the CML dataset is Tom Goldstein.

Q/A.question: What is the threshold for dataset size that requires faculty approval for CML, GAMMA, and Vulcan?
Q/A.answer: If the uncompressed/final dataset size is over 100GB, faculty approval is required.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you want to request a new dataset?
Q/A.answer: You can request a new dataset by contacting staff with a link to the dataset's official download location.

Q/A.question: What happens if the dataset size exceeds 50GB for Nexus?
Q/A.answer: If the dataset size exceeds 50GB, the Director of Computing Facilities must first approve the use of the storage space.

Q/A.question: What is required if there are terms and conditions for a dataset that exceed Creative Commons licenses?
Q/A.answer: The dataset's terms and conditions must be approved by UMD's Office of Research Administration.

Q/A.question: What is the policy regarding intermediate data generated from a dataset?
Q/A.answer: All datasets are read-only to users, and any intermediate data must be stored in a location other than the shared filesystem hosting the dataset.

Q/A.question: What should you do if you believe some generated intermediate data will be useful to others?
Q/A.answer: You should contact staff to follow procedure and seek the necessary approvals to copy the intermediate data into the shared filesystem.

Q/A.question: How are datasets accessed by users?
Q/A.answer: All datasets are accessed in read-only mode.

Q/A.question: What role do staff play in the dataset request and approval process?
Q/A.answer: Staff will inspect the dataset, check for terms and conditions, and assist in the approval process if terms exceed Creative Commons licenses.

Q/A.question: What type of system has UMIACS deployed for spam filtering?
Q/A.answer: UMIACS has deployed a system with 2 Barracuda Networks spam firewalls.

Q/A.question: How do you log in to the Barracuda spam firewall system?
Q/A.answer: You can log in using your UMIACS email address and password at either bubs.umiacs.umd.edu or pompom.umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What happens to your mail when it first flows through one of the Barracudas?
Q/A.answer: The first time your mail flows through one of the Barracudas, it will send you a mail with a new username and password.

Q/A.question: What time do you receive the quarantine summary mail from Barracuda unless configured otherwise?
Q/A.answer: You will receive the quarantine summary mail at approximately 3:30pm EST.

Q/A.question: What should you note about the auto log-in feature after a firmware upgrade?
Q/A.answer: The auto log-in through the link provided in the summary does not work due to a recent firmware upgrade on the Barracudas.

Q/A.question: What do the Barracudas do to messages that pass through them?
Q/A.answer: The Barracudas score every message that passes through them and inject varying message headers based on that score.

Q/A.question: How long is mail kept in quarantine by the Barracudas?
Q/A.answer: Mail deemed as spam will be kept in quarantine for 21 days.

Q/A.question: What happens to mail held in quarantine for longer than 21 days?
Q/A.answer: Mail held for longer than 21 days will be purged.

Q/A.question: If you receive a security warning in your browser after clicking a link, what might you need to do?
Q/A.answer: You may need to add the UMIACS Certificate Authority.

Q/A.question: How can you configure the Barracuda to deliver quarantined mail to your mailbox?
Q/A.answer: You can configure the Barracuda to deliver quarantined mail using the Barracuda web configuration.

Q/A.question: Where can you set up whitelists, blacklists, and Bayesian filtering options?
Q/A.answer: You can set these up through the Preferences tab at the top of the Barracuda web portal.

Q/A.question: What should you do to access more information about using the Barracuda?
Q/A.answer: You should download the user's guide available at the provided link.

Q/A.question: What types of support does the UMIACS Help Desk provide?
Q/A.answer: The UMIACS Help Desk provides Technical Support and Equipment Procurement.

Q/A.question: Where is the UMIACS Help Desk located?
Q/A.answer: The UMIACS Help Desk is located in the Brendan Iribe Center for Computer Science and Engineering, Room 310, 98125 Paint Branch Drive, College Park, MD 20742.

Q/A.question: What are the operating hours of the UMIACS Help Desk?
Q/A.answer: The UMIACS Help Desk hours are from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday, excluding University Holidays.

Q/A.question: Which email address should be used for technical support?
Q/A.answer: For technical support, one should email staff@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What email address should be used for equipment procurement?
Q/A.answer: For equipment procurement, one should email orders@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What email address is provided for room access requests?
Q/A.answer: For room access requests and building-related inquiries, the email to use is facilities@umiacs.umd.edu.

Q/A.question: What is the telephone number for the UMIACS Help Desk?
Q/A.answer: The telephone number for the UMIACS Help Desk is (301) 405-1775.

Q/A.question: What platform can be used to track requests at the Help Desk?
Q/A.answer: The JIRA Request Tracker can be used to track requests at the Help Desk.

Q/A.question: What should one consider when planning a visit to the Help Desk regarding its operating hours?
Q/A.answer: One should consider that the Help Desk is closed on University Holidays.

Q/A.question: Why might someone contact facilities@umiacs.umd.edu?
Q/A.answer: Someone might contact facilities@umiacs.umd.edu for room access requests or building-related inquiries.

Q/A.question: What is the purpose of the list on the Iribe Conference Rooms page?
Q/A.answer: The list provides details about the Iribe Conference Rooms that are scheduled with a UMD Google Room Resource Calendar.

Q/A.question: What login is required to view the Iribe Conference Rooms' schedule?
Q/A.answer: You need to login to your UMD Google account to view these schedules.

Q/A.question: How many people can occupy the room IRB-1127?
Q/A.answer: The room IRB-1127 has an occupancy of 12.

Q/A.question: What type of reservation method does the room IRB-1119 use?
Q/A.answer: The room IRB-1119 uses the AutoAccept reservation method.

Q/A.question: Which room has the highest occupancy and what is that occupancy?
Q/A.answer: The room IRB-4105 has the highest occupancy with a capacity of 48.

Q/A.question: Is the reservation method for room IRB-5111 AutoAccept or Moderated?
Q/A.answer: The reservation method for room IRB-5111 is AutoAccept.

Q/A.question: Which rooms have a moderated reservation method?
